Title: Director, Demand Planning AR/VR
JD:
As a leader within the Business Management team, you will be responsible for planning and owning the demand statement for our multi-product hardware portfolio within AR/VR. This role will lead and continue to build out the demand planning function and team, implementing best-in-class industry processes and tools to ultimately increase the predictability and availability of our products.
DIRECTOR, DEMAND PLANNING AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Build the organizational infrastructure to develop, manage, and continually improve demand planning systems that drive accuracy of product category and SKU based forecasts in existing and new markets.
Apply operational excellence methods to streamline processes and tasks across multiple areas and internal teams, then implement best practices, as well as timely inform cross-functional teams of any system or workflow related issues.
Help build the demand planning strategy and collaborate with Sales/Finance/Marketing/Product and Data Team leaders to develop long-term and short-term demand plans. Design comprehensive and consistent strategies, tools, and processes related to demand planning and sales forecasting.
Define and implement forecasting methodologies leveraging product, and customer segmentation strategies as facebook grows into new/undefined ecosystems and product categories.
Lead and develop a team of Demand Planners, Analysts, and Specialists establishing clear performance expectations and coaching to ensure their performance plans meet organizational objectives.
Partner with Sales, Marketing, Category, and Finance to gather forecast inputs from across the business, including but not limited to business trends, promotional/marketing plans, product inventory, production capacities, distribution changes, to develop accurate demand plans.
Represent Demand Planning as part of the S&OP process, helping to socialize and evangelize the demand plan during executive reviews.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years experience working in demand planning.
Experience working with and implementing advanced demand planning statistical modeling techniques.
Experience working in a data-driven decision making environment, leveraging industry standard KPIs to measure and improve performance.
Experience in implementing and using industry leading demand planning tools.
Bachelors’ degree.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MBA.
Consumer Electronics industry with experience planning for high volume, high mix portfolios.

Title: Accountant, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook is seeking an Accountant for AR/VR, Facebook’s hardware group which includes Oculus and Portal, with plans to release multiple products over the next few years. You will join a team of accounting professionals that support the AR/VR supply chain/manufacturing process. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting new business initiatives while ensuring accurate inventory and COGS accounting in accordance with U.S. GAAP. You are comfortable and highly effective in a rapidly changing environment. You are eager to learn and have strong communication and collaboration skills to work with cross functional teams. You will be a key contributor to ensuring we succeed in supporting business growth and maintain accountability in all our financial reporting in a high growth environment.
ACCOUNTANT, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Become a subject matter expert in matters related to inventory and COGS accounting.
Perform cost analyses and updates.
Carry out month-end close duties, such as analyzing financial transactions in general ledgers, preparing manual journal entries and preparing account reconciliations.
Participate in process improvement initiatives by partnering with cross functional process owners and enhance current tools/systems for business growth and scalability.
Assist in systems testing for any new product launches and other business initiatives.
Partner with internal and external auditors on satisfactory completion of all audit requests.
Maintain and ensure compliance with all pertinent Sarbanes-Oxley (“SOX”) documentation and requirements.
Assist with the preparation of quarterly and annual reporting packages to management.
Other ad hoc projects.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline
3+ years of experience in financial statements auditing, financial accounting or similar experience
Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and internal control best practices
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Big 4 audit experience
CPA
Experience in cost accounting

Title: AR/VR Apps Review Specialist
JD:
Our team ensures that applications shipped in the Oculus Store are high-quality and trustworthy. We review all applications to ensure they meet our Content Policy and Virtual Reality Checks. We work to improve the Oculus Store experience for users, publishers and developers through the use of automated detection tools, manual review, data analysis, guidance, and coordination with product teams. Our team is looking for a strong team lead to support our global developer community and ensure the best possible user experience within the Oculus Store. In this position, you will interface with internal teams such as Content, Policy, Legal, Marketing and Engineering, as well as with external developers and publishers. A successful candidate for this role will have strong data skills, be a strong user/developer advocate, have the ability to work successfully with multiple teams, be able to identify opportunities to improve user experience through workflows, documentation and interfaces, be biased toward action, have the ability to make quick and informed decisions, and enjoy working in a challenging environment.
AR/VR APPS REVIEW SPECIALIST RESPONSIBILITIES
Execute testing process for third party submissions to the Oculus Store to ensure apps meet technical and content policy requirements
Maintain test plan in CMS tool, collaborate with developer relations engineering team on test procedures and escalated issues
Gather information from domain experts for new products and features, coordinate training for the testing team
Report on trends and advocate for platform level solutions to common rejection reasons
Propose and drive improvements to the testing and feedback process
Communicate with developers about their submission results and provide 1:1 ticketed support
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of video game QA or application testing experience
Developer advocate, proven experience helping app developers overcome challenges to help them succeed
Communication skills and experience to clearly document complex bugs and the steps to reproduce
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
BA/BS Degree

Title: Contact Center Program Manager, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook’s AR/VR Contact Center Operations team mission is to provide exceptional global support through meaningful interactions that develop and result in customer loyalty and advocacy. We believe that through the optimization of our partner relationships and effective collaboration we can fully leverage the talent and strengths that exist across the entire partner footprint. This approach enables us to deliver exceptional customer experiences. The Contact Center Program Manager at Facebook AR/VR is a problem solver, highly organized, and an expert communicator. We’re looking for a subject matter expert who possesses a wealth of contact center and BPO management experience, has implemented industry best practices and cutting edge solutions, and has driven to desired results. This contributor will work with internal, cross functional, and partner teams to proactively remove roadblocks and improve team communication, alignment, and collaboration through their strong relationship building and expert project management skills. The ideal candidate would feel comfortable working in a Start-Up like environment, have strong leadership skills, excellent communication and inter-personal skills, and possess a highly organized approach. This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park, CA or Seattle, WA office.
CONTACT CENTER PROGRAM MANAGER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with the Facebook Customer Support Ops leadership and Partner teams across multiple sites to identify opportunities, create/implement programs, determine potential ROI, and evaluate the success of contact center initiatives and events to drive exceptional customer support.
Drive process improvements, best-practice sharing, and tools enhancements across global Contact Center operations.
Support the management team with effective team communication, proactive problem solving, information distribution.
Work to identify improvements in operational effectiveness and efficiency that will drive increases in customer satisfaction, quality, and other key performance indicators.
Work closely with stakeholders to develop the most up to date program information, own the narrative, and facilitate sessions to advance the programs.
Collate and present monthly status reports on organization wide initiatives to the CS Ops leadership team.
Assess risk, raise flags, and resolve issues before they become problems for the larger teams.
Serve as Zendesk CRM Administrator – manage the creation & maintenance of Zendesk roles, queues, macros, and routing procedures.
Travel internationally required quarterly.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience supporting a brand known for their customer centric approach.
2+ years’ project management experience focused on contact center management initiatives and customer interaction improvement.
2+ years’ experience as Zendesk Administrator.
Experience creating business requirements, detailed project plans, presentations in support of project and program initiatives.
Experience with statistics and experience recognizing patterns in data and provide recommendations based on those patterns.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience communicating and motivating large groups of people
Experience with reporting tools (Tableau or similar)
Experience in contact center support for consumer electronics
BA/BS degree or higher
5+ years’ experience in customer support operations focused role, ideally, managing contact center vendors in a B2C environment.

Title: Supply Planner, AR/VR
JD:
The role of Supply Planner is high-impact and complex, and it must be undertaken by someone who is capable of complex problem solving, cross-organizational collaboration, and holds a tenacious passion for doing “what it takes”. This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park office. The Supply Planner is responsible for end-to-end supply chain planning and product availability for a portfolio of AR/VR products, accessories and SKUs. This includes demand supply planning, capacity and factory scheduling, and leading the weekly (tactical) and monthly (strategic) Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process for the products in the assigned portfolio. The role also manages the ex-factory and supply commit processes for the associated contract manufacturing sites. Additionally, the position involves steering all stages of inventory planning from NPI to EOL for the products in his/her assigned portfolio (hero products and accessories).
SUPPLY PLANNER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Single point of contact for supply planning and product availability for the items in their portfolio. Develops tactical, capacity/material constrained production plans to fulfill the requirements created in the Demand Plan.
Understands multi-channel demand signals for the products in the assigned portfolios and provides actionable recommendations to respond/adjust trends (e-commerce, retail, enterprise, non-revenue).
Creates and maintains inventory plans for finished goods and accessories across regional DCs considering operational and fulfillment service policies, financial targets and cost-effective transportation considerations.
Owns the weekly S&OP process for assigned product portfolios, including leading the meetings and providing information to cross functional teams to support supply and demand planning objectives.
Responsible for creating, communicating and monitoring detailed requested Ship Plans at the contract manufacturing sites (forecast, commits, build plans, PO creation, E&O planning).
Partners with Contract Manufacturing Operations to ensure that site capacities are properly modeled and optimized across the network in meeting customer demand.
Responsible for the identification and resolution of supply issues, including communication, escalation and coordination of resolution.
Develops and manages inbound and outbound priorities, allocations, and backlog resolution.
Is accountable for supply chain key performance indicators (KPI) associated with the assigned product portfolio.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience participating and running S&OP meetings and processes.
Experience with ERP systems (specifically regarding planning, order management, allocations, and fulfillment).
Expert in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience retrieving insights/reports from data portals (Tableau, Business Intelligence hubs).
Experience presenting and influencing senior management.
Experience in a startup/small-team entrepreneurial environment.
Experience driving decision making through fact-based analysis and rationale.
Experience prioritizing and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
University BS or MS in supply chain or related field.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Sense of urgency, accuracy, and follow-through.
4+ years’ experience in relevant Supply Planning roles, preferably in Consumer Electronics.
Certification in materials management/supply chain (e.g., APICS) is preferred.

Title: Strategic Planning & Operations Lead for Facebook AR/VR Partnerships
JD:
The Partnerships Strategic Planning & Operations group is looking for an experienced business leader to help drive organizational planning and operational excellence for the AR/VR Partnerships efforts at Facebook, part of the Partnerships organization. This leader will partner deeply with the VP of AR/VR Partnerships, and many cross functional teams, including product marketing, product management, finance, HR, consumer marketing, etc. The primary objectives are to enable AR/VR Partnerships leadership to make analytically-driven strategic decisions and to increase operational rigor. This person must have a highly flexible skillset to juggle a range of tasks, including, but not limited to, resource planning and analysis, organizational design, business goal definition, developing data-driven business reviews, internal communications, ad hoc data deep dive analyses, coordination and leadership of critical projects across the company, and contributions to team culture and values.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about Facebook and/or AR/VR, have a proven track record of proactive operational leadership in a cross-functional environment, be a strategic thinker who can drive results, and be able to move fast while keeping focused on high impact projects. This is a full-time position and is located in Menlo Park, California.
STRATEGIC PLANNING & OPERATIONS LEAD FOR FACEBOOK AR/VR PARTNERSHIPS RESPONSIBILITIES
Strategic Planning:
Collaborate with Partnerships leaders and other internal stakeholders on key business initiatives, programs, resource planning, and special projects.
Frame decisions and contribute a strong point of view on how to build a better business.
Develop a deep understanding of the business and be the person that can connect the dots between teams to identify areas for improvement, efficiency, and collaboration.
Develop and implement go-to-market strategies for new markets, products or verticals, including organizational design to enable these strategies.
Operations:
Lead operational reviews for the AR/VR Partnerships teams to drive decision-making and review progress on goals and priorities (e.g. monthly/quarterly business reviews).
Build standard business review documents and business requirements for reporting.
Work closely with internal communications and HR teams to ensure leadership is communicating constantly and transparently within the team and across Facebook organizations.
Drive key leadership meetings and facilitate alignment on key issues and opportunities.
Identify areas of process improvement and build plans for teams to improve.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, economics, business or other relevant/quantitative disciplines.
8+ years of experience in strategic planning and/or business operations in the technology/internet space or media space.
Experience leading strategy, operations and process improvement projects at a leading management consulting firm or in a relevant strategy/operations team.
Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills, experience solving complex and diverse business problems (commercial, operational, organizational), and to drive projects from strategy to execution.
Leadership and influencing skills – experience leading/influencing stakeholders at all levels of an organization.
Experience working cross-functionally with leadership in developing and executing successful plans.
Results and detail oriented, with commercial/business acumen.
Experience working in Excel and PowerPoint.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience building great businesses and for Facebook products, particularly for VR products.
Experience developing or overseeing advanced quantitative analysis and derive actionable insights.
Knowledge of SQL.

Title: Events Manager, AR/VR Marketing
JD:
Facebook AR/VR’s Event, Experience and Community Marketing team produces experiences that create product and platform evangelists. We engage communities in real time and deliver the promise that technology builds human connections. We plan, program and produce large scale experimental events throughout the year and we create scalable programs to deliver best in class product experiences and demonstrations globally across Facebook’s complete AR/VR product line.


We are looking for an Event Manager to help serve as the driving force behind Facebook AR/VR’s on-the-ground presence at some of the largest and most impactful events in the world. The team has experienced tremendous growth over the past year and has new, exciting leadership that is looking to take event marketing to the next level. The ideal candidate will have a passion for strategy, value of analytics and a great understanding of events and production. Success in this role will require deep, strategic collaboration with cross-agency partners and flawless execution of events.
EVENTS MANAGER, AR/VR MARKETING RESPONSIBILITIES
Manifest Facebook AR/VR hardware and software across priority events, including: tentpole and launch events, strategic cultural events and high-profile industry tradeshows (e.g. CES, Davos, SxSW, Game Developers Conference, E3, Cannes Lions)
Support Head of Event & Experience Marketing in the development of strategy and budget for annualized schedule of events
Collaborate with Event Operations team to manage agency relationships, with an bias towards efficiency and the delivery of measurable results
Lead cross-functional meetings with superior attention to detail and the development of robust project management tools to ensure the team and deliverables remain on schedule and under budget
This job includes frequent travel (approximately 50%) to execute events at major global trade shows and festivals
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in budget management of projects $1 million plus
Experience working with large brands
Interest in events at the intersection of culture and technology
5+ years experience in a large scale experiential executions (industry trade shows, cultural activations, roadshows, consumer activations)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
VR and gaming experience
Experience with successful execution of B2B and B2C events
Mix of agency and in-house professional experience
Experience working with large tech brands

Additionally, you’ll organize and provide leadership to multiple team leaders across the globe. develop a high-performing team with the appropriate skills, knowledge and bench strength to deliver value to the enterprise

ensure compliance with external (eg. SOX) and internal policies for asset management

Title: AR/VR Revenue Accountant
JD:
Facebook, Inc. is seeking a dynamic individual to fill the position of Revenue Accountant. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of Facebook’s AR/VR hardware revenue processes and continually developing and enhancing financial systems supporting a fast growing global virtual reality business. Additional responsibilities will include month end close activities and fulfillment of internal and external audit requests. The individual must be a self-starter and work with limited direction while taking full ownership of their areas of responsibility. They will be expected to problem solve, recommend solutions, and exercise good business judgment while performing their functions. He/she is expected to have a strong business acumen coupled with a technical accounting background and strong communication skills to effectively facilitate information flow between cross-functional business partners and the Finance organization.
AR/VR REVENUE ACCOUNTANT RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist with month end close procedures including preparation and/or review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other duties as necessary.

Experience with problem-solving and moving from blank state to well-defined problem with a methodology
Communication skills. Presentation experience with using insights to influence executives and colleagues

Title: Customer Experience Analyst, AR/VR
JD:
As a Customer Experience Analyst at AR/VR CX team, you will be responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that will drive operational improvements. You will be working with cross-functional partners across the AR/VR organizations to gather requirements and create reports and dashboards that meet their needs. You will be synthesizing customer experience surveys with other transactional, operational, and demographic sources of data across customer journey to proactively identify customer pain points and areas of opportunity. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of customer insights and statistical analysis, experience deriving insights from customer surveys, and demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with internal and external partners.
CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ANALYST, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Translate the Customer Experience survey findings (e.g. NPS, CSAT) across different touch points into actionable insights that influence decision making and business optimizations
Perform deep dive analyses to identify emerging trends, wins, and opportunity areas in customer experience
Gather business requirements and collaborate with internal and external cross-functional partners on data capture and distribution strategies
Design and build insight-driven tools, reports, and dashboards that provide real-time and easy access to customer feedback across the organization
Consolidate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers
Advocate for customers by continuously developing periodic and ad hoc reports and proactively distributing the insights among appropriate stakeholders
Create and maintain robust pipelines of data that yield visualized dashboards
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field of study
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, data science, marketing analytics, or similar quantitative fields
Experience with creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience working with and knowledge of Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), CX surveys, and customer feedback
Proficiency in querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using R or Python or SPSS or a similar scripting language/tool for statistical analysis
Experience with building reports and dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with customer experience platforms such as Medallia
Experience building and managing text analytics tools
Experience working on quantitative research projects in the area of consumer insights
Experience working or in support of a CX or VoC team

This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park office. The Supply Planner is responsible for end-to-end supply chain planning and product availability for a portfolio of AR/VR products, accessories and SKUs. This includes demand supply planning, capacity and factory scheduling, and leading the weekly (tactical) and monthly (strategic) Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process for the products in the assigned portfolio. The role also manages the ex-factory and supply commit processes for the associated contract manufacturing sites. Additionally, the position involves steering all stages of inventory planning from NPI to EOL for the products in his/her assigned portfolio (hero products and accessories).
SUPPLY PLANNER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Single point of contact for supply planning and product availability for the items in their portfolio. Develops tactical, capacity/material constrained production plans to fulfill the requirements created in the Demand Plan.
Understands multi-channel demand signals for the products in the assigned portfolios and provides actionable recommendations to respond/adjust trends (e-commerce, retail, enterprise, non-revenue).
Creates and maintains inventory plans for finished goods and accessories across regional DCs considering operational and fulfillment service policies, financial targets and cost-effective transportation considerations.
Owns the weekly S&OP process for assigned product portfolios, including leading the meetings and providing information to cross functional teams to support supply and demand planning objectives.
Responsible for creating, communicating and monitoring detailed requested Ship Plans at the contract manufacturing sites (forecast, commits, build plans, PO creation, E&O planning).
Partners with Contract Manufacturing Operations to ensure that site capacities are properly modeled and optimized across the network in meeting customer demand.
Responsible for the identification and resolution of supply issues, including communication, escalation and coordination of resolution.
Develops and manages inbound and outbound priorities, allocations, and backlog resolution.
Is accountable for supply chain key performance indicators (KPI) associated with the assigned product portfolio.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience participating and running S&OP meetings and processes.
Experience with ERP systems (specifically regarding planning, order management, allocations, and fulfillment).
Expert in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience retrieving insights/reports from data portals (Tableau, Business Intelligence hubs).
Experience presenting and influencing senior management.
Experience in a startup/small-team entrepreneurial environment.
Experience driving decision making through fact-based analysis and rationale.
Experience prioritizing and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
University BS or MS in supply chain or related field.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Sense of urgency, accuracy, and follow-through.
4+ years’ experience in relevant Supply Planning roles, preferably in Consumer Electronics.
Certification in materials management/supply chain (e.g., APICS) is preferred.

Title: Display Research and Development Engineer, AR/VR
JD:
Minimum qualifications:

Ph.D. degree in a Display related field or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of work experience in display and R&D Environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge and experience of Micro-LED architecture, epitaxy material, epitaxy growth equipment (MBE/MOCVD) and process.
Knowledge of major design, test and manufacturing challenges for micro-LED displays.
Knowledge of micro-display (LCoS, DLP, micro-OLED, micro-LED, etc) technology, familiar with display and backplane design, and fabrication process.
Knowledge of all display technologies.
Established relationships with micro-display suppliers, and equipment and material vendors.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
About the job
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.
Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) are rapidly evolving as important new areas in consumer products. The Daydream team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the hardware, platform, and ecosystem for ground-breaking devices, apps, and tools. In order to address complex challenges, we develop and integrate our own systems. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies to improve user productivity.

As a Display Research and Development (R&D) Engineer, you'll design and build the visual systems of the future. You will be part of a team developing high-performance and low-power displays that enable Google’s continuous innovations in AR/VR devices. Additionally, you will assess, introduce, and evaluate new and existing technologies.
The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
Responsibilities
Innovate, develop, and integrate leading edge micro-LED display technologies for VR/AR.
Demonstrate deep understanding of relationship between display technologies and its business goals.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g. Electrical, Organizational/Mechanical, Software Engineering, Display, UX) to define requirements and specifications of an advanced display to optimize the visual system.
Guide and work with display partners, and even material/component/equipment supply chain partners to solve the key challenges during display development phase.
Evaluate and test the key display image, efficiency, power, and reliability performance.

JD:

Title: Marketing Insights Researcher, AR/VR
JD:
The AR/VR team is seeking a Marketing Insights Researcher who will harness and translate insights into strategic marketing plans and communications, and create strong cross-functional partnerships with the AR/VR marketing and products teams. This role will also help develop new hardware brands, improve product market fit, execute go-to-market plans, support creative development, optimize marketing to drive conversion of product funnel and ultimately create more value for consumers.

The ideal candidate will have exceptional research skills across both qualitative and quantitative methodologies, proven hands-on experience as a practitioner and project manager, a hunger to drive significant business impact/outcomes, and an interest to remain deeply engaged in the execution of work. Strong time management and communication skills are critical, and experience with technology is a must.

This role is based in Menlo Park, but travel may be required up to 10-15% of the time.
MARKETING INSIGHTS RESEARCHER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborative partner with Marketing, UX, and Product organizations to understand consumer needs and product use cases, define brand positioning, develop audiences, improve product market fit, execute go-to-market plans, and optimize/improve marketing communications to achieve business objectives
Design and execute comprehensive, quantitative and qualitative research solutions, at both the product and brand level
Translate data insights into actions and recommendations. Core focus will be on understanding audience, marketing and communications strategy, at both a brand and product level, but will also include new product development and definition
Ability to partner with Decision Science to develop hypotheses and comprehensive test and measurement plans, to design and execute experiments to achieve marketing objectives and drive marketing effectiveness
Ability to interface directly with leaders, and act as an effective communicator to influence decision-making and product planning

4+ years of experience in marketing research or product research teams
Experience with both qualitative and quantitative methods
Experience in leading or executing insights-driven campaigns/product launches from definition to execution, driving and influencing product and marketing decision-making
Experience engaging both at the technical/product level as well as on brand marketing/communications
Experience engaging in research work at a tactical/executional level
Experience with problem-solving and moving from blank state to well-defined problem with a methodology
Communication skills. Presentation experience with using insights to influence executives and colleagues

Experience thriving in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, drive change, and collaborate effectively with a variety of partners
Experience working in consumer hardware and tech
Client side and agency experience in new product/service development and launch

Title: Customer Experience Analyst, AR/VR
JD:
As a Customer Experience Analyst at AR/VR CX team, you will be responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that will drive operational improvements. You will be working with cross-functional partners across the AR/VR organizations to gather requirements and create reports and dashboards that meet their needs. You will be synthesizing customer experience surveys with other transactional, operational, and demographic sources of data across customer journey to proactively identify customer pain points and areas of opportunity. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of customer insights and statistical analysis, experience deriving insights from customer surveys, and demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with internal and external partners.
CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ANALYST, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Translate the Customer Experience survey findings (e.g. NPS, CSAT) across different touch points into actionable insights that influence decision making and business optimizations
Perform deep dive analyses to identify emerging trends, wins, and opportunity areas in customer experience
Gather business requirements and collaborate with internal and external cross-functional partners on data capture and distribution strategies
Design and build insight-driven tools, reports, and dashboards that provide real-time and easy access to customer feedback across the organization
Consolidate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers
Advocate for customers by continuously developing periodic and ad hoc reports and proactively distributing the insights among appropriate stakeholders
Create and maintain robust pipelines of data that yield visualized dashboards
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field of study
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, data science, marketing analytics, or similar quantitative fields
Experience with creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience working with and knowledge of Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), CX surveys, and customer feedback
Proficiency in querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using R or Python or SPSS or a similar scripting language/tool for statistical analysis
Experience with building reports and dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with customer experience platforms such as Medallia
Experience building and managing text analytics tools
Experience working on quantitative research projects in the area of consumer insights
Experience working or in support of a CX or VoC team

Title: Customer Experience Analyst, AR/VR
JD:
As a Customer Experience Analyst at AR/VR CX team, you will be responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that will drive operational improvements. You will be working with cross-functional partners across the AR/VR organizations to gather requirements and create reports and dashboards that meet their needs. You will be synthesizing customer experience surveys with other transactional, operational, and demographic sources of data across customer journey to proactively identify customer pain points and areas of opportunity. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of customer insights and statistical analysis, experience deriving insights from customer surveys, and demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with internal and external partners.
CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ANALYST, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Translate the Customer Experience survey findings (e.g. NPS, CSAT) across different touch points into actionable insights that influence decision making and business optimizations
Perform deep dive analyses to identify emerging trends, wins, and opportunity areas in customer experience
Gather business requirements and collaborate with internal and external cross-functional partners on data capture and distribution strategies
Design and build insight-driven tools, reports, and dashboards that provide real-time and easy access to customer feedback across the organization
Consolidate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers
Advocate for customers by continuously developing periodic and ad hoc reports and proactively distributing the insights among appropriate stakeholders
Create and maintain robust pipelines of data that yield visualized dashboards
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field of study
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, data science, marketing analytics, or similar quantitative fields
Experience with creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience working with and knowledge of Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), CX surveys, and customer feedback
Proficiency in querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using R or Python or SPSS or a similar scripting language/tool for statistical analysis
Experience with building reports and dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with customer experience platforms such as Medallia
Experience building and managing text analytics tools
Experience working on quantitative research projects in the area of consumer insights
Experience working or in support of a CX or VoC team

Title: Supply Planner, AR/VR
JD:
The role of Supply Planner is high-impact and complex, and it must be undertaken by someone who is capable of complex problem solving, cross-organizational collaboration, and holds a tenacious passion for doing “what it takes”. This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park office. The Supply Planner is responsible for end-to-end supply chain planning and product availability for a portfolio of AR/VR products, accessories and SKUs. This includes demand supply planning, capacity and factory scheduling, and leading the weekly (tactical) and monthly (strategic) Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process for the products in the assigned portfolio. The role also manages the ex-factory and supply commit processes for the associated contract manufacturing sites. Additionally, the position involves steering all stages of inventory planning from NPI to EOL for the products in his/her assigned portfolio (hero products and accessories).
SUPPLY PLANNER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Single point of contact for supply planning and product availability for the items in their portfolio. Develops tactical, capacity/material constrained production plans to fulfill the requirements created in the Demand Plan.
Understands multi-channel demand signals for the products in the assigned portfolios and provides actionable recommendations to respond/adjust trends (e-commerce, retail, enterprise, non-revenue).
Creates and maintains inventory plans for finished goods and accessories across regional DCs considering operational and fulfillment service policies, financial targets and cost-effective transportation considerations.
Owns the weekly S&OP process for assigned product portfolios, including leading the meetings and providing information to cross functional teams to support supply and demand planning objectives.
Responsible for creating, communicating and monitoring detailed requested Ship Plans at the contract manufacturing sites (forecast, commits, build plans, PO creation, E&O planning).
Partners with Contract Manufacturing Operations to ensure that site capacities are properly modeled and optimized across the network in meeting customer demand.
Responsible for the identification and resolution of supply issues, including communication, escalation and coordination of resolution.
Develops and manages inbound and outbound priorities, allocations, and backlog resolution.
Is accountable for supply chain key performance indicators (KPI) associated with the assigned product portfolio.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience participating and running S&OP meetings and processes.
Experience with ERP systems (specifically regarding planning, order management, allocations, and fulfillment).
Expert in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience retrieving insights/reports from data portals (Tableau, Business Intelligence hubs).
Experience presenting and influencing senior management.
Experience in a startup/small-team entrepreneurial environment.
Experience driving decision making through fact-based analysis and rationale.
Experience prioritizing and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
University BS or MS in supply chain or related field.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Sense of urgency, accuracy, and follow-through.
4+ years’ experience in relevant Supply Planning roles, preferably in Consumer Electronics.
Certification in materials management/supply chain (e.g., APICS) is preferred.

Title: Display Research and Development Engineer, AR/VR
JD:
Minimum qualifications:

Ph.D. degree in a Display related field or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of work experience in display and R&D Environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge and experience of Micro-LED architecture, epitaxy material, epitaxy growth equipment (MBE/MOCVD) and process.
Knowledge of major design, test and manufacturing challenges for micro-LED displays.
Knowledge of micro-display (LCoS, DLP, micro-OLED, micro-LED, etc) technology, familiar with display and backplane design, and fabrication process.
Knowledge of all display technologies.
Established relationships with micro-display suppliers, and equipment and material vendors.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
About the job
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.
Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) are rapidly evolving as important new areas in consumer products. The Daydream team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the hardware, platform, and ecosystem for ground-breaking devices, apps, and tools. In order to address complex challenges, we develop and integrate our own systems. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies to improve user productivity.

As a Display Research and Development (R&D) Engineer, you'll design and build the visual systems of the future. You will be part of a team developing high-performance and low-power displays that enable Google’s continuous innovations in AR/VR devices. Additionally, you will assess, introduce, and evaluate new and existing technologies.
The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
Responsibilities
Innovate, develop, and integrate leading edge micro-LED display technologies for VR/AR.
Demonstrate deep understanding of relationship between display technologies and its business goals.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g. Electrical, Organizational/Mechanical, Software Engineering, Display, UX) to define requirements and specifications of an advanced display to optimize the visual system.
Guide and work with display partners, and even material/component/equipment supply chain partners to solve the key challenges during display development phase.
Evaluate and test the key display image, efficiency, power, and reliability performance.

Title: Customer Experience Analyst, AR/VR
JD:
As a Customer Experience Analyst at AR/VR CX team, you will be responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that will drive operational improvements. You will be working with cross-functional partners across the AR/VR organizations to gather requirements and create reports and dashboards that meet their needs. You will be synthesizing customer experience surveys with other transactional, operational, and demographic sources of data across customer journey to proactively identify customer pain points and areas of opportunity. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of customer insights and statistical analysis, experience deriving insights from customer surveys, and demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with internal and external partners.
CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ANALYST, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Translate the Customer Experience survey findings (e.g. NPS, CSAT) across different touch points into actionable insights that influence decision making and business optimizations
Perform deep dive analyses to identify emerging trends, wins, and opportunity areas in customer experience
Gather business requirements and collaborate with internal and external cross-functional partners on data capture and distribution strategies
Design and build insight-driven tools, reports, and dashboards that provide real-time and easy access to customer feedback across the organization
Consolidate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers
Advocate for customers by continuously developing periodic and ad hoc reports and proactively distributing the insights among appropriate stakeholders
Create and maintain robust pipelines of data that yield visualized dashboards
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field of study
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, data science, marketing analytics, or similar quantitative fields
Experience with creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience working with and knowledge of Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), CX surveys, and customer feedback
Proficiency in querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using R or Python or SPSS or a similar scripting language/tool for statistical analysis
Experience with building reports and dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with customer experience platforms such as Medallia
Experience building and managing text analytics tools
Experience working on quantitative research projects in the area of consumer insights
Experience working or in support of a CX or VoC team

JD:

Schedule: 40 hours per week, Monday-Friday
Assignment Length: 6 month contract
Job Description

HireArt is helping our client hire a Content Manager, AR/VR for Japanese-speaking audiences. Candidates must have bilingual fluency in Japanese and English.
As a Content Manager, you’ll set up editorial calendars, campaigns, and the taxonomy for Apps and Games relevant to Japan. This role will also manage a CMS content for the company’s e-commerce site that brings innovative and cutting edge AR/VR products to Japanese markets across the globe.

This is a highly cross-functional role collaborating with teams including content discovery, marketing, engineering, and product teams to launch content within the company’s CMS.
The ideal candidate for this role has a strong knowledge of the games industry in Japan, cultural moments, and an expert on tailoring content for Japanese users. A strong technical background and exceptional writing and communication skills in both Japanese and English, with extensive knowledge of operational roles, creative editorial work, and developer relations.
As Content Manager, AR/VR, you will:
Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.
Assign, edit, and write content for the App Store, including short-form write-ups, deep dives, developer interviews and translate long-format articles from cross-functional teams.
Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.
Requirements
3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position (with potential for extension) through HireArt and based in Menlo Park, CA. Open to candidates willing to relocate at their own expense.

Title: Customer Experience Analyst, AR/VR
JD:
As a Customer Experience Analyst at AR/VR CX team, you will be responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that will drive operational improvements. You will be working with cross-functional partners across the AR/VR organizations to gather requirements and create reports and dashboards that meet their needs. You will be synthesizing customer experience surveys with other transactional, operational, and demographic sources of data across customer journey to proactively identify customer pain points and areas of opportunity. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of customer insights and statistical analysis, experience deriving insights from customer surveys, and demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with internal and external partners.
CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ANALYST, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform deep dive analyses to identify emerging trends, wins, and opportunity areas in customer experience
Gather business requirements and collaborate with internal and external cross-functional partners on data capture and distribution strategies
Design and build insight-driven tools, reports, and dashboards that provide real-time and easy access to customer feedback across the organization
Consolidate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers
Advocate for customers by continuously developing periodic and ad hoc reports and proactively distributing the insights among appropriate stakeholders
Create and maintain robust pipelines of data that yield visualized dashboards
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field of study
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, data science, marketing analytics, or similar quantitative fields
Experience with creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience working with and knowledge of Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), CX surveys, and customer feedback
Proficiency in querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using R or Python or SPSS or a similar scripting language/tool for statistical analysis
Experience with building reports and dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with customer experience platforms such as Medallia
Experience building and managing text analytics tools
Experience working on quantitative research projects in the area of consumer insights
Experience working or in support of a CX or VoC team

Title: Supply Planner, AR/VR
JD:
The role of Supply Planner is high-impact and complex, and it must be undertaken by someone who is capable of complex problem solving, cross-organizational collaboration, and holds a tenacious passion for doing “what it takes”. This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park office. The Supply Planner is responsible for end-to-end supply chain planning and product availability for a portfolio of AR/VR products, accessories and SKUs. This includes demand supply planning, capacity and factory scheduling, and leading the weekly (tactical) and monthly (strategic) Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process for the products in the assigned portfolio. The role also manages the ex-factory and supply commit processes for the associated contract manufacturing sites. Additionally, the position involves steering all stages of inventory planning from NPI to EOL for the products in his/her assigned portfolio (hero products and accessories).
SUPPLY PLANNER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Single point of contact for supply planning and product availability for the items in their portfolio. Develops tactical, capacity/material constrained production plans to fulfill the requirements created in the Demand Plan.
Understands multi-channel demand signals for the products in the assigned portfolios and provides actionable recommendations to respond/adjust trends (e-commerce, retail, enterprise, non-revenue).
Creates and maintains inventory plans for finished goods and accessories across regional DCs considering operational and fulfillment service policies, financial targets and cost-effective transportation considerations.
Owns the weekly S&OP process for assigned product portfolios, including leading the meetings and providing information to cross functional teams to support supply and demand planning objectives.
Responsible for creating, communicating and monitoring detailed requested Ship Plans at the contract manufacturing sites (forecast, commits, build plans, PO creation, E&O planning).
Partners with Contract Manufacturing Operations to ensure that site capacities are properly modeled and optimized across the network in meeting customer demand.
Responsible for the identification and resolution of supply issues, including communication, escalation and coordination of resolution.
Develops and manages inbound and outbound priorities, allocations, and backlog resolution.
Is accountable for supply chain key performance indicators (KPI) associated with the assigned product portfolio.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience participating and running S&OP meetings and processes.
Experience with ERP systems (specifically regarding planning, order management, allocations, and fulfillment).
Expert in Excel and PowerPoint. Experience retrieving insights/reports from data portals (Tableau, Business Intelligence hubs).
Experience presenting and influencing senior management.
Experience in a startup/small-team entrepreneurial environment.
Experience driving decision making through fact-based analysis and rationale.
Experience prioritizing and multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
University BS or MS in supply chain or related field.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Sense of urgency, accuracy, and follow-through.
4+ years’ experience in relevant Supply Planning roles, preferably in Consumer Electronics.
Certification in materials management/supply chain (e.g., APICS) is preferred.

Title: AR/VR Sales Finance Analyst
JD:
The Finance team oversees our investments in headcount, operating expenses and capital investment. We focus on using our unique view into the numbers to see trends and opportunities that are developing within the company as well as across the industry. Successful candidates for this team have a bias towards action, exceptional partnership and communication skills, and know-how to balance getting the details right while still moving fast. Title: Display Research and Development Engineer, AR/VR
JD:
Minimum qualifications:

Ph.D. degree in a Display related field or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of work experience in display and R&D Environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge and experience of Micro-LED architecture, epitaxy material, epitaxy growth equipment (MBE/MOCVD) and process.
Knowledge of major design, test and manufacturing challenges for micro-LED displays.
Knowledge of micro-display (LCoS, DLP, micro-OLED, micro-LED, etc) technology, familiar with display and backplane design, and fabrication process.
Knowledge of all display technologies.
Established relationships with micro-display suppliers, and equipment and material vendors.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
About the job
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.
Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) are rapidly evolving as important new areas in consumer products. The Daydream team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the hardware, platform, and ecosystem for ground-breaking devices, apps, and tools. In order to address complex challenges, we develop and integrate our own systems. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies to improve user productivity.

As a Display Research and Development (R&D) Engineer, you'll design and build the visual systems of the future. You will be part of a team developing high-performance and low-power displays that enable Google’s continuous innovations in AR/VR devices. Additionally, you will assess, introduce, and evaluate new and existing technologies.
The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
Responsibilities
Innovate, develop, and integrate leading edge micro-LED display technologies for VR/AR.
Demonstrate deep understanding of relationship between display technologies and its business goals.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g. Electrical, Organizational/Mechanical, Software Engineering, Display, UX) to define requirements and specifications of an advanced display to optimize the visual system.
Guide and work with display partners, and even material/component/equipment supply chain partners to solve the key challenges during display development phase.
Evaluate and test the key display image, efficiency, power, and reliability performance.

This role will also help develop new hardware brands, improve product market fit, execute go-to-market plans, support creative development, optimize marketing to drive conversion of product funnel and ultimately create more value for consumers.

The ideal candidate will have exceptional research skills across both qualitative and quantitative methodologies, proven hands-on experience as a practitioner and project manager, a hunger to drive significant business impact/outcomes, and an interest to remain deeply engaged in the execution of work. Strong time management and communication skills are critical, and experience with technology is a must.

This role is based in Menlo Park, but travel may be required up to 10-15% of the time.
MARKETING INSIGHTS RESEARCHER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborative partner with Marketing, UX, and Product organizations to understand consumer needs and product use cases, define brand positioning, develop audiences, improve product market fit, execute go-to-market plans, and optimize/improve marketing communications to achieve business objectives
Design and execute comprehensive, quantitative and qualitative research solutions, at both the product and brand level
Translate data insights into actions and recommendations. Core focus will be on understanding audience, marketing and communications strategy, at both a brand and product level, but will also include new product development and definition
Ability to partner with Decision Science to develop hypotheses and comprehensive test and measurement plans, to design and execute experiments to achieve marketing objectives and drive marketing effectiveness
Ability to interface directly with leaders, and act as an effective communicator to influence decision-making and product planning
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of experience in marketing research or product research teams
Experience with both qualitative and quantitative methods
Experience in leading or executing insights-driven campaigns/product launches from definition to execution, driving and influencing product and marketing decision-making
Experience engaging both at the technical/product level as well as on brand marketing/communications
Experience engaging in research work at a tactical/executional level
Experience with problem-solving and moving from blank state to well-defined problem with a methodology
Communication skills. Presentation experience with using insights to influence executives and colleagues
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience thriving in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, drive change, and collaborate effectively with a variety of partners
Experience working in consumer hardware and tech
Client side and agency experience in new product/service development and launch

Title: Customer Experience Analyst, AR/VR
JD:
As a Customer Experience Analyst at AR/VR CX team, you will be responsible for translating customer feedback into actionable insights that will drive operational improvements. You will be working with cross-functional partners across the AR/VR organizations to gather requirements and create reports and dashboards that meet their needs. You will be synthesizing customer experience surveys with other transactional, operational, and demographic sources of data across customer journey to proactively identify customer pain points and areas of opportunity. The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of customer insights and statistical analysis, experience deriving insights from customer surveys, and demonstrated experience working cross-functionally with internal and external partners.
CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE ANALYST, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Translate the Customer Experience survey findings (e.g. NPS, CSAT) across different touch points into actionable insights that influence decision making and business optimizations
Perform deep dive analyses to identify emerging trends, wins, and opportunity areas in customer experience
Gather business requirements and collaborate with internal and external cross-functional partners on data capture and distribution strategies
Design and build insight-driven tools, reports, and dashboards that provide real-time and easy access to customer feedback across the organization
Consolidate customer feedback data with other transactional, operational, and behavioral sources of data to paint a clear picture of experience drivers
Advocate for customers by continuously developing periodic and ad hoc reports and proactively distributing the insights among appropriate stakeholders
Create and maintain robust pipelines of data that yield visualized dashboards
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field of study
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, data science, marketing analytics, or similar quantitative fields
Experience with creating reports, visualizations, and dashboards and communicating results and analyses to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience working with and knowledge of Customer Experience or Voice of Customer metrics (NPS, CSAT, etc.), CX surveys, and customer feedback
Proficiency in querying, joining, and manipulating raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using R or Python or SPSS or a similar scripting language/tool for statistical analysis
Experience with building reports and dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with customer experience platforms such as Medallia
Experience building and managing text analytics tools
Experience working on quantitative research projects in the area of consumer insights
Experience working or in support of a CX or VoC team

HR DIRECTOR, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES

Title: AR/VR - Product Designer
JD:
Join a team of designers who are passionate about creating a cutting edge Virtual Reality experience and establishing VR Platform as an industry leader. You will be expected to use your full range of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills, and you will own the full experience.


You’ll be responsible for designing, researching, prototyping, and implementing features for incremental changes as well as future iterations. You’ll work with and get feedback from the Design, Engineering and Product management teams in AR/VR. This position is full-time and based in Menlo Park.

AR/VR - PRODUCT DESIGNER RESPONSIBILITIES
Synthesize broad and ambiguous business requirements and accomplish them through design
Help establish preliminary processes to align cross-functional teams
Contribute to strategic decisions, working with the Design, Product and Executive teams
Design end-to-end flows and visuals and individually contribute to the product and feature set
Give and solicit real time feedback from other designers to continually raise the quality and craftsmanship of the product
Partner with PMs, engineers, researchers, content strategist & QA, overseeing the implementation of the user experience from product conception to launch - as well as post-launch design support
Quickly solve issues with your cross-functional leads
Clearly articulate design decisions to a vast set of internal stakeholders
Step back and help build product strategy – thinking beyond just incremental features
Advocate for product design within the AR/VR organization and throughout Facebook
Thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience designing and experience managing and leading in cross-functional environments
10+ years of experience in shipping software products
Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methods for user research, including A/B testing frameworks
Experience thinking about product strategy and vision (not just 'how it should look' but 'what we should build and why)
Experience with Android mobile
A portfolio featuring examples of both visual and interaction work
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Unity experience

Title: Director, Business Enablement AR/VR
JD:
As Director of Business Enablement at Facebook AR/VR, you will bridge the technical and business worlds as you partner closely with cross-functional teams to drive the creation of a business systems strategy and conceive, design, prioritize, and deliver key process and information systems solutions that enable the business to meet its ambitious goals. You will provide cross-functional leadership to chart strategic direction in sync with overall company roadmaps, while delivering flexible enterprise-level capabilities that meet near-term business needs. The right candidate will have a track-record of leading initiatives, ability to navigate strategic and tactical challenges, work in ambiguity, strong business acumen, and capacity to lead several key initiatives in parallel, working with large, extended and cross-functional teams.
DIRECTOR, BUSINESS ENABLEMENT AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES

Directly manage team chartered with defining business requirements and shepherding projects through implementation as well as QA, portfolio/program management, process documentation, production support, and business analytics
Become a trusted partner and advisor for business leaders and engineering development teams, and ensure team members represent business owners in all capability development initiatives
Ensure strategic and operational alignment between all critical business systems and their user communities

Cross-functional partnership, experience navigating across teams with objectives to translate business strategies, initiatives, goals, and objectives into project proposals
Bachelor’s degree

Consumer Electronics experience

Title: Technology Communications Director, AR/VR
JD:
We are searching for an experienced leader to oversee communications for AR/VR Experiences and Games at Facebook. The ideal candidate is someone who can oversee a range of high-impact communications programs, leading a team of exceptional communications professionals and partnering closely with executives to set strategy. This person will be a lead on the team that's responsible for global communications for Facebook's AR, VR and hardware products, including Oculus. This person will also be responsible for driving communications for VR experiences, media, developer and games.


A passion for AR/VR technology and the ability to move fast in fluid situations is key for this role. This individual excels at working collaboratively with high-level executives and colleagues alike, understands the content and games world and can consistently deliver high-quality work, even under severe time constraints.

TECHNOLOGY COMMUNICATIONS DIRECTOR, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead communications strategy across VR social experiences, media, developer and games
Drive comms strategy for Oculus Connect and other industry events including GDC, PAX, and E3
Work with leaders within the company to communicate our vision for AR/VR
Serve as a spokesperson, as needed
Work cross functionally to help set and communicate developer and content policies
Attend leadership meetings to provide counsel on future products, games, and experiences
Collaborate with marketing, events, and creative teams to help steer go to market strategies
Lead and develop a team of communications professionals

Bachelor's degree in English, Communications or a related field
15+ years of experience in games, entertainment or live platforms PR, or a related field

Title: Product Designer, AR/VR
JD:
Join a team of designers, content strategists and researchers who are passionate about building the next personal computing platform that puts people at the center and enables them to be more present and more connected with people they care most about. Facebook’s new devices team is looking for a Product Designer to join the Experiences or Platform pillars.


You’ll partner with multiple teams around the company and work across a variety of touchpoints (Assistant, Messenger, WhatsApp, Instagram) to craft thoughtful experiences that add real value to people’s lives. You’ll be responsible for defining, designing, researching, prototyping, and implementing new features as well as future iterations.


We're looking for a designer who isn't afraid to jump in and explore new challenges. You have a balance of interaction design, visual design, and product thinking skills. You are customer obsessed and research driven. You’re a natural collaborator and can work independently and in a team environment.


PRODUCT DESIGNER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into something useful and valuable for people using our products
Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product and executive teams
Work collaboratively with Product, Research and Engineering partners from concept through completion and future iterations
Own the end-to-end design (interaction, visual, etc.) across multiple features and projects
Present designs, prototypes and concepts to cross functional partners and stakeholders
Provide implementation guidance to engineers and ensure features launch at the highest quality
Stay on top of industry trends and emerging technologies
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of industry experience as a Product or Interaction Designer
A portfolio of work that demonstrates a breadth of visual and interaction design skills
Experience working in a technical environment
Experience working with research and data to drive decision making

Experience designing for hardware products and new interaction models

JD:
The position will involve developing and driving strong retail relationships in North America with Amazon. This person will be charged with developing and executing a comprehensive sales strategy at the customer level as a subset of the overall organizational vision.


The candidate will possess analytical skills and have the ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management. The candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment, working cross-functionally with the Product Management, Marketing, and Operations teams to develop new ways we can improve the purchase experience for customers.
AR/VR STRATEGIC ACCOUNT MANAGER, ONLINE RETAIL RESPONSIBILITIES
Ability to communicate with internal and external stakeholders
Seek out data, provide insights, and deliver foresight that drives the growth of Facebook hardware at Amazon
Define and manage an annual business plan with Amazon for key activities to be carried out each quarter, clearly defined resource allocations and planned investments from retail partner
Develop and maintain executive relationships
Partner with cross-functional peers in Marketing, Ops, and Finance to optimize merchandising, AMS, AMG investment, digital shelf, brand shop, product detail pages, ratings & reviews (e.g. Vine), and overall consumer experience
Own inventory planning with forecast management for Amazon
Support quarterly MDF allocation and reconciliation process
Review Sell In/Out data to identify new opportunities within existing product ranges
Plan all new product launches in collaboration with marketing and business operations, deliver clear and concise communication and plan to partners
Provide an objective viewpoint based on an in-depth understanding of commercial and competitive information
Collaborate and provide retail expertise to other Facebook teams
Work closely with Operations to implement a CPFR process with retail and distributor partners
Achieve monthly/quarterly/annual targets

Proven track record in delivery of sales quotas against business plans
BA/BS in Business or Marketing related field (or similar work experience)
6+ years experience in Sales, Account Management or Business Development for Amazon
Experience managing workload within timeframes
Negotiation and communication experience with experience in operators, retail & distribution agreements

Capacity to get things done at short notice while collecting information from a variety of internal and external sources

The Channel Operations Manager, currently based in Menlo Park, CA (HQ), will play an exciting and important role in ensuring alignment between the strategic direction of the organization and enabling operational excellence for the function.
