Title: QA Lead, AR/VR
JD:
The Oculus team at Facebook builds the VR hardware and platform to let you experience anything, anywhere, with anyone. Additionally, Facebook has teams dedicated to building social experiences in VR that make it easier to spend time with your friends, wherever they are. Virtual reality’s potential to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Oculus Research is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, advanced optics, eye tracking, mixed reality, and new ways to map the human body. Oculus is a world leader in the design of virtual and augmented reality systems. Come work alongside expert software engineers and research scientists to create the technology that makes VR and AR pervasive and universal. Join the adventure of a lifetime as we make science fiction real and change the world. As a QA Lead at Oculus, you'll ensure the delivery of a high-quality software and platform for Oculus product lines. You'll be responsible for building and executing test strategy and plans across multiple products and platforms while working with engineering teams to identify and resolve defects. You will ensure the release of Oculus product will delight our customers. The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented engineer, with a passion for building great software products and improving engineering efficiency.
QA LEAD, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Build a test-driven engineering culture that drives improvements in quality.
Implement process changes to scale testing efforts across multiple products.
Test functionality of games and apps built for Oculus ecosystem.
Plan, develop and execute test coverage for multiple platforms.
Diagnose issues, report defects, and propose regression tests to discover reoccurrences.
Work with engineers and project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution.
Own the process of creating metrics to measure and monitor product performance.
Partner with Automation and Infrastructure team to leverage automation to allow better reliability and scalability.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Experience debugging applications on Platform, PC and Mobile component.
Experience building, shipping, and maintaining commercial software.
Experience coding in Python, PHP, Java, C/C++ or equivalent language.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in managing black box and white box testing.

Title: Global Supply Manager, Silicon (Facebook AR/VR)
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for managing spend covering all raw materials, from individual components on a PCB, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with all suppliers and manufacturers. The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain.


Facebook is seeking an experienced Global Supply Manager that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. You will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans Silicon components for our AR/VR space.
GLOBAL SUPPLY MANAGER, SILICON (FACEBOOK AR/VR) RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Global Semiconductor/Electronics Sourcing function. Driving an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Subject matter expert in commodity cost profiles and should cost models.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Semiconductor technology, Architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Continually benchmark the industry to monitor technology trends and ensure best practices are incorporated into the Facebook AR/VR supply chain.
Drive Early Supplier Involvement initiatives to ensure our commodity suppliers are proactively providing input into new product designs and future product roadmaps.
Establish supplier selection criteria, evaluate alternative suppliers, manage RFQ process, and drive final supplier selection in partnership with Hardware Engineering and Supply Base Engineering.
Initiate and lead ongoing Cost Reduction programs to ensure the lowest possible total cost, including product cost, transportation cost, inventory cost, and cost of quality.
Formulate contingency plans to de-risk technical challenges, long lead time, single source, and any supply issue.
Institute programs to optimize schedule flexibility while minimizing excess inventory exposure.
Work with Supply Base Engineering and our CM partners to avoid any potential part shortages or quality problems which are affecting production schedules.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, or related field.
10+ years work experience in Procurement or related disciplines specific to electrical including strategic silicon and board electrical sourcing.
Experience in supplier evaluation/selection, should cost models, contract negotiation and supply base management.
Leadership, program management and cross-functional teamwork experience.
Experience with communicating and to influence all levels of management.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with high volume, consumer electronics products.
10+ years experience managing global Silicon commodities.
Experience operating in dynamic, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.

Title: QA Lead, AR/VR
JD:
The Oculus team at Facebook builds the VR hardware and platform to let you experience anything, anywhere, with anyone. Additionally, Facebook has teams dedicated to building social experiences in VR that make it easier to spend time with your friends, wherever they are. Virtual reality’s potential to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Oculus Research is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, advanced optics, eye tracking, mixed reality, and new ways to map the human body. Oculus is a world leader in the design of virtual and augmented reality systems. Come work alongside expert software engineers and research scientists to create the technology that makes VR and AR pervasive and universal. Join the adventure of a lifetime as we make science fiction real and change the world. As a QA Lead at Oculus, you'll ensure the delivery of a high-quality software and platform for Oculus product lines. You'll be responsible for building and executing test strategy and plans across multiple products and platforms while working with engineering teams to identify and resolve defects. You will ensure the release of Oculus product will delight our customers. The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented engineer, with a passion for building great software products and improving engineering efficiency.
QA LEAD, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Build a test-driven engineering culture that drives improvements in quality.
Implement process changes to scale testing efforts across multiple products.
Test functionality of games and apps built for Oculus ecosystem.
Plan, develop and execute test coverage for multiple platforms.
Diagnose issues, report defects, and propose regression tests to discover reoccurrences.
Work with engineers and project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution.
Own the process of creating metrics to measure and monitor product performance.
Partner with Automation and Infrastructure team to leverage automation to allow better reliability and scalability.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Experience debugging applications on Platform, PC and Mobile component.
Experience building, shipping, and maintaining commercial software.
Experience coding in Python, PHP, Java, C/C++ or equivalent language.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in managing black box and white box testing.

Title: Content Manager, AR/VR (Japanese Market)
JD:
Location: Menlo Park, CA
Schedule: 40 hours per week, Monday-Friday
Assignment Length: 6 month contract
Job Description

HireArt is helping our client hire a Content Manager, AR/VR for Japanese-speaking audiences. Candidates must have bilingual fluency in Japanese and English.
As a Content Manager, you’ll set up editorial calendars, campaigns, and the taxonomy for Apps and Games relevant to Japan. This role will also manage a CMS content for the company’s e-commerce site that brings innovative and cutting edge AR/VR products to Japanese markets across the globe.

This is a highly cross-functional role collaborating with teams including content discovery, marketing, engineering, and product teams to launch content within the company’s CMS.
The ideal candidate for this role has a strong knowledge of the games industry in Japan, cultural moments, and an expert on tailoring content for Japanese users. A strong technical background and exceptional writing and communication skills in both Japanese and English, with extensive knowledge of operational roles, creative editorial work, and developer relations.
As Content Manager, AR/VR, you will:
Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.
Assign, edit, and write content for the App Store, including short-form write-ups, deep dives, developer interviews and translate long-format articles from cross-functional teams.
Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.
Requirements
3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position (with potential for extension) through HireArt and based in Menlo Park, CA. Open to candidates willing to relocate at their own expense.
HireArt is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Global Supply Manager, Silicon (Facebook AR/VR)
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for managing spend covering all raw materials, from individual components on a PCB, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with all suppliers and manufacturers. The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain.


Facebook is seeking an experienced Global Supply Manager that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. You will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans Silicon components for our AR/VR space.
GLOBAL SUPPLY MANAGER, SILICON (FACEBOOK AR/VR) RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Global Semiconductor/Electronics Sourcing function. Driving an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Subject matter expert in commodity cost profiles and should cost models.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Semiconductor technology, Architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Continually benchmark the industry to monitor technology trends and ensure best practices are incorporated into the Facebook AR/VR supply chain.
Drive Early Supplier Involvement initiatives to ensure our commodity suppliers are proactively providing input into new product designs and future product roadmaps.
Establish supplier selection criteria, evaluate alternative suppliers, manage RFQ process, and drive final supplier selection in partnership with Hardware Engineering and Supply Base Engineering.
Initiate and lead ongoing Cost Reduction programs to ensure the lowest possible total cost, including product cost, transportation cost, inventory cost, and cost of quality.
Formulate contingency plans to de-risk technical challenges, long lead time, single source, and any supply issue.
Institute programs to optimize schedule flexibility while minimizing excess inventory exposure.
Work with Supply Base Engineering and our CM partners to avoid any potential part shortages or quality problems which are affecting production schedules.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, or related field.
10+ years work experience in Procurement or related disciplines specific to electrical including strategic silicon and board electrical sourcing.
Experience in supplier evaluation/selection, should cost models, contract negotiation and supply base management.
Leadership, program management and cross-functional teamwork experience.
Experience with communicating and to influence all levels of management.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with high volume, consumer electronics products.
10+ years experience managing global Silicon commodities.
Experience operating in dynamic, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.

Title: AR/VR Sales Finance Analyst
JD:
The Finance team oversees our investments in headcount, operating expenses and capital investment. We focus on using our unique view into the numbers to see trends and opportunities that are developing within the company as well as across the industry. Successful candidates for this team have a bias towards action, exceptional partnership and communication skills, and know-how to balance getting the details right while still moving fast. You will join the team that manages the finances for AR/VR, Facebook’s consumer hardware group, which includes Oculus and Portal and plans to release multiple products over the next few years. In this role you will be providing comprehensive sales finance support for our direct-to-consumer business. The ideal candidate would have experience in providing finance support to ecommerce or retail teams, or both. You will gain invaluable experience in a position that offers significant responsibility and interaction with management, as well as considerable opportunity to have a large impact within a growing consumer hardware Finance organization at Facebook.
AR/VR SALES FINANCE ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES
Create strong business partnerships with Sales leadership and AR/VR leadership overall
Provide financial leadership across planning, budgeting, forecasting and long-range planning
Design and build frameworks for efficient headcount and opex allocations
Provide hands-on analytic support and develop actionable insights that will influence key decision makers to effectively drive sales

Drive process improvements by partnering with up-stream process owners and enhance current tools/systems related to financial management

2+ years of finance experience
Experience with MS Office/Google Docs, Salesforce, Oracle, Hyperion, SQL, Tableau
Experience developing analytical frameworks and communicating financial concepts to leadership
Experience partnering with and influencing functional leaders
Experience working and problem solving independently, organizing workload and priorities, and completing tasks on time
Experience in applicable accounting concepts and financial planning
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MBA or MS in a quantitative field
2+ years of finance experience in a consulting firm, investment bank, or a high-growth tech company with a focus on omnichannel direct-to-consumer sales
Working knowledge of Python
Experience with consumer and enterprise business models

Title: Mechanical Engineer - AR/VR Accessories
JD:
As a Mechanical Engineer on the Facebook AR/VR accessories team, you will help bring products to market that enable our core products to reach additional customer needs, make it easier to use our products longer, and enhance the core product experiences. You’ll be part of a product group that is focused on rapid development and execution of accessory products through a combination of in-house teams and overseeing external partners (both CM and ODM development models). You will work on cutting edge technologies with a diverse cross-functional team of engineers and scientists that pioneer mechanical, electrical, materials, firmware, software and computer vision solutions. We value people who work well in teams, can take project ownership at a systems level, and are able to drive a concept from a high fidelity prototype to a high-volume consumer product.
MECHANICAL ENGINEER - AR/VR ACCESSORIES RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Industrial Design, Hardware Engineering and Product teams to create functional prototypes based on concepts in the accessories roadmap and deliver final products to mass production.
Identify components, materials, and manufacturing process that achieve a high quality product within cost targets at high volume.
Create mechanical architecture and detailed 3D models according to established specifications.
Leverage internal resources and drive overseas partners (ODM/JDM/CM) to expand the capabilities of our team and deliver on projects.
Apply engineering and tolerance techniques to high precision design requirements in the areas such as optics, electro-mechanicals, and battery/power systems.
Establish and refine product design process, best practices, and/or tools for the organization.
Lead cross-functional design reviews and engineering discussions.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience.
7+ years of experience in a hands-on Engineering/Design role with experience in high volume consumer electronics and product development.
A history of full mechanical system ownership in at least two shipping products.
Experience working with China-based vendors remotely and in-person, including a variety of engineering engagement models (CM, JDM and ODM).
Problem solving skills and experience working independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Manufacturing knowledge and experience (Design for assembly, DFM with injection molding, die-cast, machining, sheet metals, die-cuts etc.).
Knowledge of designing electrical sub-systems (PCBs, FPCs, interconnects, batteries, etc.).
Experience with system level design and working with cross-functional teams including Engineering, Product Design, Research, etc.
3D CAD design experience and working with complex ID surfaces.
Understanding of GD&T and tolerance analysis methods.
Experience of building part and assembly prototypes in a prototype shop environment.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of product design/prototyping and R&D experience, including full systems ownership.
Mandarin language skills.
NX/Teamcenter CAD system knowledge.
Knowledge of statistical problem solving approach.
Design Analysis experience (FEA Structural Simulations).
Experience with wearables and soft-goods design.
Experience with designing handheld or wearable electronics for high volume manufacturing.
Knowledge for AR/VR and video conferencing technologies.

Facebook is seeking to fill the role of Accounting Manager, AR/VR supporting the virtual reality (AR/VR) business. The team’s focus is connecting people through the Portal products and expand the ever changing virtual and augment reality platforms and provide an immersive experience to the end user. Partner with Finance, Operations and Business Development teams to understand business models, and provide accounting support for all existing contracts and new deals on a forward-looking basis.

Document technical accounting positions on significant multiple element business arrangements.
Assist in development of accounting policies and operations for new accounting initiatives and business processes.

8+ years of experience in accounting or finance

Title: Revenue Manager, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook is seeking to fill the role of Revenue Manager supporting the virtual reality (AR/VR) business. Our AR/VR business includes hardware (Oculus and Portal products) and software products. The team’s focus is connecting people through the Portal products and expand the ever changing virtual and augment reality platforms and provide an immersive experience to the end user. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that our AR/VR sales and related revenue arrangements meet all revenue recognition criteria in addition to adhering to internal policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities will include owning the month end close accounting, and fulfillment of internal and external audit requests. The individual must be a self-starter and work with limited direction while taking full ownership of their areas of responsibility. They will be expected to problem solve, recommend solutions and exercise good business judgment while performing their functions. The candidate is expected to have a strong business acumen coupled with a technical accounting background and very strong systems and communication skills to effectively facilitate information flow between the Sales, Product, Engineering and Finance organizations. Candidate must be a driven, high energy, customer service focused individual that can work well with internal and external customers at all levels.
REVENUE MANAGER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with product and engineering teams to understand new business models, and design and implement scalable finance operational processes and systems to support the business.
Review revenue contracts to ensure compliance with GAAP (ASC 606) and internal policies.
Document technical accounting positions on significant multiple element revenue arrangements.
Own month end close procedures for the AR/VR business including preparation and review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other duties as necessary.
Streamline and improve existing finance systems and processes to enable the business and finance function to scale.
Fulfillment of internal and external audit requests.
Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to operationalize and implement various marketing initiatives.
Partner with cross-functional teams to research customer queries/issues and coordinate timely resolution.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
CPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
Proficient with ASC 606 and experience with implementing of such accounting guidance
Experience with implementing SOX 404 as well as on-going documentation
8+ years of experience in Finance/Accounting
Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Internal Controls
Project management and systems implementation experience
Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Big 4/public company experience
Experience working with Core Engineering and Payments Engineering and E-Commerce teams
Experience in the global retail and hardware industry
Experience with ASC 606 (Multiple Element Arrangement) accounting implementation
Experience with Oracle ERP

Title: Display Research and Development Engineer, AR/VR
JD:
Minimum qualifications:

Ph.D. degree in a Display related field or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of work experience in display and R&D Environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge and experience of Micro-LED architecture, epitaxy material, epitaxy growth equipment (MBE/MOCVD) and process.
Knowledge of major design, test and manufacturing challenges for micro-LED displays.
Knowledge of micro-display (LCoS, DLP, micro-OLED, micro-LED, etc) technology, familiar with display and backplane design, and fabrication process.
Knowledge of all display technologies.
Established relationships with micro-display suppliers, and equipment and material vendors.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
About the job
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.
Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) are rapidly evolving as important new areas in consumer products. The Daydream team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the hardware, platform, and ecosystem for ground-breaking devices, apps, and tools. In order to address complex challenges, we develop and integrate our own systems. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies to improve user productivity.

As a Display Research and Development (R&D) Engineer, you'll design and build the visual systems of the future. You will be part of a team developing high-performance and low-power displays that enable Google’s continuous innovations in AR/VR devices. Additionally, you will assess, introduce, and evaluate new and existing technologies.
The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
Responsibilities
Innovate, develop, and integrate leading edge micro-LED display technologies for VR/AR.
Demonstrate deep understanding of relationship between display technologies and its business goals.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g. Electrical, Organizational/Mechanical, Software Engineering, Display, UX) to define requirements and specifications of an advanced display to optimize the visual system.
Guide and work with display partners, and even material/component/equipment supply chain partners to solve the key challenges during display development phase.
Evaluate and test the key display image, efficiency, power, and reliability performance.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. Title: Director, Product, AR/VR Growth
JD:
In the AR/VR organization, we're building the next generation of devices and experiences that let you experience anything, anywhere, with anyone. This includes Oculus and Portal products, AR and VR software and content, and research and development labs. AR/VR’s potential to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Our team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, advanced optics, eye tracking, mixed reality, and new ways to map the human body. The AR/VR Growth team is focused on connecting people to new AR/VR technologies, this includes driving new user growth and existing user retention. The Growth team is innovating and applying the best of Facebook Growth practices in a hardware product environment.


AR/VR Product Group manager will lead teams of engineers and designers to build products. We are looking for extremely entrepreneurial Product Leaders to help innovate and execute product initiatives across the company. This position is full-time and based at our Menlo Park office.
DIRECTOR, PRODUCT, AR/VR GROWTH RESPONSIBILITIES
Establish shared vision across the company by building consensus on Growth strategy and priorities leading to product execution.
Understand how to prioritize highest impact opportunities based on analysis, product strategy, and technical development.
Drive product development with a team of world-class engineers, designers, and data scientists.
Integrate design thinking, strategic metrics design, and rigour hypothesis driven experimentation to maximize impact on growth trajectories.
Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of experience in product management, product data science, or engineering for software products and technologies.
Proven track record in optimizing user acquisition channels, conversion funnels, and monetization.
Experience in user psychology, and a track-record of using these insights to create great user experiences that also accomplish business results.
Experience leading with intuition but validating through data-driven experimentation and user research.
Experience collaborating with research, design, engineering, and analytics to drive growth initiatives.

Title: Manager, Display Strategic Sourcing - AR/VR
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for spends from raw materials, to the individual components on a board, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with various suppliers and manufacturers. The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain.


Facebook is seeking a leader that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. Together with your team and numerous internal partners, you will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans the AR/VR space.
MANAGER, DISPLAY STRATEGIC SOURCING - AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Global Display module Sourcing function. Driving an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Display technology, Architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Analyze, develop and implement supplier capacity and custom Display “should cost” model.
Develop deep technical and commercial relationships with executive management at suppliers.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Work in partnership with the various engineering teams to develop an approved and qualified supply base, develop strategic partnerships that address our needs and, on an ongoing basis, continuously improve supplier performance.
Partner with cross-functional teams (i.e., PM, engineering, quality, ID, PD, logistics, etc.) to continuously improve overall system-level landed cost and identify strategic trends in Facebook’s design practices that will have an impact on procurement.
Influence engineering and architecture teams for NPI development strategy and implementation, optimizing design/materials/process selection to drive lowest cost, industry leading quality, and continuity of predictable supply.
Lead Total Cost Reduction program to ensure the lowest possible total cost, including product cost, transportation cost, inventory cost, and cost of quality.
Develop commodity supplier sourcing strategy ensuring the supplier is capable of meeting Facebook’s current and future technical and business requirements.
Drive Early Supplier Involvement initiatives to ensure our suppliers are proactively providing input into new product designs and future product roadmaps.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of sourcing and procurement experience in Display and/or Electronics Commodity and technology management, including demonstrated experience managing overall supplier performance.
Engineering or Technical BS degree.
Experience working in enterprises with hardware portfolio.
Expertise in market analysis to dissect market size, players, customers, growth, technology replacements/forecasts, pricing trends, etc., to formulate sourcing strategies.
Expertise in financial statement analysis to derive should-cost models and cost competitiveness/financial strengths of suppliers, as well as gathering market intelligence.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced Engineering degree and/or MBA.

Title: Content Manager, AR/VR (Japanese Market)
JD:
Location: Menlo Park, CA
Schedule: 40 hours per week, Monday-Friday
Assignment Length: 6 month contract
Job Description

HireArt is helping our client hire a Content Manager, AR/VR for Japanese-speaking audiences. Candidates must have bilingual fluency in Japanese and English.
As a Content Manager, you’ll set up editorial calendars, campaigns, and the taxonomy for Apps and Games relevant to Japan. This role will also manage a CMS content for the company’s e-commerce site that brings innovative and cutting edge AR/VR products to Japanese markets across the globe.

This is a highly cross-functional role collaborating with teams including content discovery, marketing, engineering, and product teams to launch content within the company’s CMS.
The ideal candidate for this role has a strong knowledge of the games industry in Japan, cultural moments, and an expert on tailoring content for Japanese users. A strong technical background and exceptional writing and communication skills in both Japanese and English, with extensive knowledge of operational roles, creative editorial work, and developer relations.
As Content Manager, AR/VR, you will:
Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.
Assign, edit, and write content for the App Store, including short-form write-ups, deep dives, developer interviews and translate long-format articles from cross-functional teams.
Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.
Requirements
3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position (with potential for extension) through HireArt and based in Menlo Park, CA. Open to candidates willing to relocate at their own expense.
HireArt is an Equal Opportunity Employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Global Supply Manager, Silicon (Facebook AR/VR)
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for managing spend covering all raw materials, from individual components on a PCB, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with all suppliers and manufacturers. The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain.


Facebook is seeking an experienced Global Supply Manager that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. You will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans Silicon components for our AR/VR space.
GLOBAL SUPPLY MANAGER, SILICON (FACEBOOK AR/VR) RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Global Semiconductor/Electronics Sourcing function. Driving an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Subject matter expert in commodity cost profiles and should cost models.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Semiconductor technology, Architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Continually benchmark the industry to monitor technology trends and ensure best practices are incorporated into the Facebook AR/VR supply chain.
Drive Early Supplier Involvement initiatives to ensure our commodity suppliers are proactively providing input into new product designs and future product roadmaps.
Establish supplier selection criteria, evaluate alternative suppliers, manage RFQ process, and drive final supplier selection in partnership with Hardware Engineering and Supply Base Engineering.
Initiate and lead ongoing Cost Reduction programs to ensure the lowest possible total cost, including product cost, transportation cost, inventory cost, and cost of quality.
Formulate contingency plans to de-risk technical challenges, long lead time, single source, and any supply issue.
Institute programs to optimize schedule flexibility while minimizing excess inventory exposure.
Work with Supply Base Engineering and our CM partners to avoid any potential part shortages or quality problems which are affecting production schedules.

Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, or related field.
10+ years work experience in Procurement or related disciplines specific to electrical including strategic silicon and board electrical sourcing.
Experience in supplier evaluation/selection, should cost models, contract negotiation and supply base management.
Leadership, program management and cross-functional teamwork experience.
Experience with communicating and to influence all levels of management.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with high volume, consumer electronics products.
10+ years experience managing global Silicon commodities.
Experience operating in dynamic, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.

Title: AR/VR Sales Finance Analyst
JD:
The Finance team oversees our investments in headcount, operating expenses and capital investment. We focus on using our unique view into the numbers to see trends and opportunities that are developing within the company as well as across the industry. Successful candidates for this team have a bias towards action, exceptional partnership and communication skills, and know-how to balance getting the details right while still moving fast. You will join the team that manages the finances for AR/VR, Facebook’s consumer hardware group, which includes Oculus and Portal and plans to release multiple products over the next few years. In this role you will be providing comprehensive sales finance support for our direct-to-consumer business. The ideal candidate would have experience in providing finance support to ecommerce or retail teams, or both. You will gain invaluable experience in a position that offers significant responsibility and interaction with management, as well as considerable opportunity to have a large impact within a growing consumer hardware Finance organization at Facebook.
AR/VR SALES FINANCE ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES
Create strong business partnerships with Sales leadership and AR/VR leadership overall
Provide financial leadership across planning, budgeting, forecasting and long-range planning
Design and build frameworks for efficient headcount and opex allocations
Provide hands-on analytic support and develop actionable insights that will influence key decision makers to effectively drive sales
Help define and implement scalable financial processes related to month-end and quarter-end close, including accruals and reporting
Provide FP&A support, including headcount and budget tracking
Drive process improvements by partnering with up-stream process owners and enhance current tools/systems related to financial management
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics or equivalent
2+ years of finance experience
Experience with MS Office/Google Docs, Salesforce, Oracle, Hyperion, SQL, Tableau
Experience developing analytical frameworks and communicating financial concepts to leadership
Experience partnering with and influencing functional leaders
Experience working and problem solving independently, organizing workload and priorities, and completing tasks on time
Experience in applicable accounting concepts and financial planning
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
MBA or MS in a quantitative field
2+ years of finance experience in a consulting firm, investment bank, or a high-growth tech company with a focus on omnichannel direct-to-consumer sales
Working knowledge of Python
Experience with consumer and enterprise business models

Title: Mechanical Engineer - AR/VR Accessories
JD:
As a Mechanical Engineer on the Facebook AR/VR accessories team, you will help bring products to market that enable our core products to reach additional customer needs, make it easier to use our products longer, and enhance the core product experiences. You’ll be part of a product group that is focused on rapid development and execution of accessory products through a combination of in-house teams and overseeing external partners (both CM and ODM development models). You will work on cutting edge technologies with a diverse cross-functional team of engineers and scientists that pioneer mechanical, electrical, materials, firmware, software and computer vision solutions. We value people who work well in teams, can take project ownership at a systems level, and are able to drive a concept from a high fidelity prototype to a high-volume consumer product.
MECHANICAL ENGINEER - AR/VR ACCESSORIES RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Industrial Design, Hardware Engineering and Product teams to create functional prototypes based on concepts in the accessories roadmap and deliver final products to mass production.
Identify components, materials, and manufacturing process that achieve a high quality product within cost targets at high volume.
Create mechanical architecture and detailed 3D models according to established specifications.
Leverage internal resources and drive overseas partners (ODM/JDM/CM) to expand the capabilities of our team and deliver on projects.
Apply engineering and tolerance techniques to high precision design requirements in the areas such as optics, electro-mechanicals, and battery/power systems.
Establish and refine product design process, best practices, and/or tools for the organization.
Lead cross-functional design reviews and engineering discussions.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience.
7+ years of experience in a hands-on Engineering/Design role with experience in high volume consumer electronics and product development.
A history of full mechanical system ownership in at least two shipping products.
Experience working with China-based vendors remotely and in-person, including a variety of engineering engagement models (CM, JDM and ODM).
Problem solving skills and experience working independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Manufacturing knowledge and experience (Design for assembly, DFM with injection molding, die-cast, machining, sheet metals, die-cuts etc.).
Knowledge of designing electrical sub-systems (PCBs, FPCs, interconnects, batteries, etc.).
Experience with system level design and working with cross-functional teams including Engineering, Product Design, Research, etc.
3D CAD design experience and working with complex ID surfaces.
Understanding of GD&T and tolerance analysis methods.
Experience of building part and assembly prototypes in a prototype shop environment.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of product design/prototyping and R&D experience, including full systems ownership.
Mandarin language skills.
NX/Teamcenter CAD system knowledge.
Knowledge of statistical problem solving approach.
Design Analysis experience (FEA Structural Simulations).
Experience with wearables and soft-goods design.
Experience with designing handheld or wearable electronics for high volume manufacturing.
Knowledge for AR/VR and video conferencing technologies.

Title: QA Lead, AR/VR
JD:
The Oculus team at Facebook builds the VR hardware and platform to let you experience anything, anywhere, with anyone. Additionally, Facebook has teams dedicated to building social experiences in VR that make it easier to spend time with your friends, wherever they are. Virtual reality’s potential to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Oculus Research is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, advanced optics, eye tracking, mixed reality, and new ways to map the human body. Oculus is a world leader in the design of virtual and augmented reality systems. Come work alongside expert software engineers and research scientists to create the technology that makes VR and AR pervasive and universal. Join the adventure of a lifetime as we make science fiction real and change the world. As a QA Lead at Oculus, you'll ensure the delivery of a high-quality software and platform for Oculus product lines. You'll be responsible for building and executing test strategy and plans across multiple products and platforms while working with engineering teams to identify and resolve defects. You will ensure the release of Oculus product will delight our customers. The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented engineer, with a passion for building great software products and improving engineering efficiency.
QA LEAD, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Build a test-driven engineering culture that drives improvements in quality.
Implement process changes to scale testing efforts across multiple products.
Test functionality of games and apps built for Oculus ecosystem.
Plan, develop and execute test coverage for multiple platforms.
Diagnose issues, report defects, and propose regression tests to discover reoccurrences.
Work with engineers and project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution.
Own the process of creating metrics to measure and monitor product performance.
Partner with Automation and Infrastructure team to leverage automation to allow better reliability and scalability.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Experience debugging applications on Platform, PC and Mobile component.
Experience building, shipping, and maintaining commercial software.
Experience coding in Python, PHP, Java, C/C++ or equivalent language.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in managing black box and white box testing.

Title: Revenue Manager, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook is seeking to fill the role of Revenue Manager supporting the virtual reality (AR/VR) business. Our AR/VR business includes hardware (Oculus and Portal products) and software products. The team’s focus is connecting people through the Portal products and expand the ever changing virtual and augment reality platforms and provide an immersive experience to the end user. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that our AR/VR sales and related revenue arrangements meet all revenue recognition criteria in addition to adhering to internal policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities will include owning the month end close accounting, and fulfillment of internal and external audit requests. The individual must be a self-starter and work with limited direction while taking full ownership of their areas of responsibility. They will be expected to problem solve, recommend solutions and exercise good business judgment while performing their functions. The candidate is expected to have a strong business acumen coupled with a technical accounting background and very strong systems and communication skills to effectively facilitate information flow between the Sales, Product, Engineering and Finance organizations. Candidate must be a driven, high energy, customer service focused individual that can work well with internal and external customers at all levels.
REVENUE MANAGER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with product and engineering teams to understand new business models, and design and implement scalable finance operational processes and systems to support the business.
Review revenue contracts to ensure compliance with GAAP (ASC 606) and internal policies.
Document technical accounting positions on significant multiple element revenue arrangements.
Own month end close procedures for the AR/VR business including preparation and review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other duties as necessary.
Streamline and improve existing finance systems and processes to enable the business and finance function to scale.
Fulfillment of internal and external audit requests.
Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to operationalize and implement various marketing initiatives.
Partner with cross-functional teams to research customer queries/issues and coordinate timely resolution.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
CPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
Proficient with ASC 606 and experience with implementing of such accounting guidance
Experience with implementing SOX 404 as well as on-going documentation
8+ years of experience in Finance/Accounting
Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Internal Controls
Project management and systems implementation experience
Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Big 4/public company experience
Experience working with Core Engineering and Payments Engineering and E-Commerce teams
Experience in the global retail and hardware industry
Experience with ASC 606 (Multiple Element Arrangement) accounting implementation
Experience with Oracle ERP

Title: Display Research and Development Engineer, AR/VR
JD:
Minimum qualifications:

Ph.D. degree in a Display related field or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of work experience in display and R&D Environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge and experience of Micro-LED architecture, epitaxy material, epitaxy growth equipment (MBE/MOCVD) and process.
Knowledge of major design, test and manufacturing challenges for micro-LED displays.
Knowledge of micro-display (LCoS, DLP, micro-OLED, micro-LED, etc) technology, familiar with display and backplane design, and fabrication process.
Knowledge of all display technologies.
Established relationships with micro-display suppliers, and equipment and material vendors.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
About the job
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.
Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) are rapidly evolving as important new areas in consumer products. The Daydream team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the hardware, platform, and ecosystem for ground-breaking devices, apps, and tools. In order to address complex challenges, we develop and integrate our own systems. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies to improve user productivity.

As a Display Research and Development (R&D) Engineer, you'll design and build the visual systems of the future. You will be part of a team developing high-performance and low-power displays that enable Google’s continuous innovations in AR/VR devices. Additionally, you will assess, introduce, and evaluate new and existing technologies.
The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
Responsibilities
Innovate, develop, and integrate leading edge micro-LED display technologies for VR/AR.
Demonstrate deep understanding of relationship between display technologies and its business goals.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g. Electrical, Organizational/Mechanical, Software Engineering, Display, UX) to define requirements and specifications of an advanced display to optimize the visual system.
Guide and work with display partners, and even material/component/equipment supply chain partners to solve the key challenges during display development phase.
Evaluate and test the key display image, efficiency, power, and reliability performance.

Title: Director, Product, AR/VR Growth

Title: Manager, Display Strategic Sourcing - AR/VR
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for spends from raw materials, to the individual components on a board, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with various suppliers and manufacturers. The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain.


Facebook is seeking a leader that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. Together with your team and numerous internal partners, you will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans the AR/VR space.
MANAGER, DISPLAY STRATEGIC SOURCING - AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Global Display module Sourcing function. Driving an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Display technology, Architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Analyze, develop and implement supplier capacity and custom Display “should cost” model.
Develop deep technical and commercial relationships with executive management at suppliers.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Work in partnership with the various engineering teams to develop an approved and qualified supply base, develop strategic partnerships that address our needs and, on an ongoing basis, continuously improve supplier performance.
Partner with cross-functional teams (i.e., PM, engineering, quality, ID, PD, logistics, etc.) to continuously improve overall system-level landed cost and identify strategic trends in Facebook’s design practices that will have an impact on procurement.
Influence engineering and architecture teams for NPI development strategy and implementation, optimizing design/materials/process selection to drive lowest cost, industry leading quality, and continuity of predictable supply.
Lead Total Cost Reduction program to ensure the lowest possible total cost, including product cost, transportation cost, inventory cost, and cost of quality.
Develop commodity supplier sourcing strategy ensuring the supplier is capable of meeting Facebook’s current and future technical and business requirements.
Drive Early Supplier Involvement initiatives to ensure our suppliers are proactively providing input into new product designs and future product roadmaps.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of sourcing and procurement experience in Display and/or Electronics Commodity and technology management, including demonstrated experience managing overall supplier performance.
Engineering or Technical BS degree.
Experience working in enterprises with hardware portfolio.
Expertise in market analysis to dissect market size, players, customers, growth, technology replacements/forecasts, pricing trends, etc., to formulate sourcing strategies.
Expertise in financial statement analysis to derive should-cost models and cost competitiveness/financial strengths of suppliers, as well as gathering market intelligence.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced Engineering degree and/or MBA.

Title: Mechanical Engineer - AR/VR Accessories
JD:

You’ll be part of a product group that is focused on rapid development and execution of accessory products through a combination of in-house teams and overseeing external partners (both CM and ODM development models). Create mechanical architecture and detailed 3D models according to established specifications.
Leverage internal resources and drive overseas partners (ODM/JDM/CM) to expand the capabilities of our team and deliver on projects.
Apply engineering and tolerance techniques to high precision design requirements in the areas such as optics, electro-mechanicals, and battery/power systems.

Title: Horizon TPM Lead - Facebook AR/VR Experiences
JD:
At Facebook AR/VR Experiences, this TPM leader will be driving efforts to create interactive virtual reality experiences that combine creativity and social play. These experiences will explore and define the future of online social interaction. As the Horizon TPM Lead for Facebook AR/VR Experiences working within the Experiences Team at Facebook, this TPM leader will drive the team responsible for Facebook Horizon - an ever-expanding VR world where users can explore, play, and create in extraordinary ways. In this role, you have the opportunity to apply your leadership and technical skills to help talented cross-functional teams create interactive virtual reality experiences, combine creativity and social play, and build the future of online social interaction. The ideal candidate is an experienced program leader (producer, development director, general manager etc.) with a games industry or other 3D interactive technology background and a passion for virtual reality, virtual worlds and collaborative online social experience. This role will be based in our Menlo Park, CA office.
HORIZON TPM LEAD - FACEBOOK AR/VR EXPERIENCES RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead technical program management for projects that break new ground and define categories and are consistent with Facebook’s mission.
Day-to-day decision-making and leadership for AR/VR Social Experiences Management including internal teams and external partnerships.
Work cross-functionally with partner technology and business teams to get software products developed and shipped on time and within budget.
Collaborate with AR/VR Experiences leadership team to define future products and product enhancements.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of management experience.
5+ years experience in managing complex ambiguous software products with a variety of stakeholders.
Experience shipping a software product built in Unity and/or similar game engines from pre-production through to live.
Experience leading multiple teams & managing multiple projects concurrently.
Experience with the product development process, tools and systems.
Organizational communication, coordination and multi-tasking experience.

Experience with managing third-party vendors.
Experience with VR technology and connecting the world in a meaningful way.

Title: QA Lead, AR/VR
JD:
The Oculus team at Facebook builds the VR hardware and platform to let you experience anything, anywhere, with anyone. Additionally, Facebook has teams dedicated to building social experiences in VR that make it easier to spend time with your friends, wherever they are. Virtual reality’s potential to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Oculus Research is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, advanced optics, eye tracking, mixed reality, and new ways to map the human body. Oculus is a world leader in the design of virtual and augmented reality systems. Come work alongside expert software engineers and research scientists to create the technology that makes VR and AR pervasive and universal. Join the adventure of a lifetime as we make science fiction real and change the world. As a QA Lead at Oculus, you'll ensure the delivery of a high-quality software and platform for Oculus product lines. You'll be responsible for building and executing test strategy and plans across multiple products and platforms while working with engineering teams to identify and resolve defects. You will ensure the release of Oculus product will delight our customers. The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented engineer, with a passion for building great software products and improving engineering efficiency.
QA LEAD, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Build a test-driven engineering culture that drives improvements in quality.
Implement process changes to scale testing efforts across multiple products.
Test functionality of games and apps built for Oculus ecosystem.
Plan, develop and execute test coverage for multiple platforms.
Diagnose issues, report defects, and propose regression tests to discover reoccurrences.
Work with engineers and project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution.
Own the process of creating metrics to measure and monitor product performance.
Partner with Automation and Infrastructure team to leverage automation to allow better reliability and scalability.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Experience debugging applications on Platform, PC and Mobile component.
Experience building, shipping, and maintaining commercial software.
Experience coding in Python, PHP, Java, C/C++ or equivalent language.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in managing black box and white box testing.

Title: Revenue Manager, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook is seeking to fill the role of Revenue Manager supporting the virtual reality (AR/VR) business. Our AR/VR business includes hardware (Oculus and Portal products) and software products. The team’s focus is connecting people through the Portal products and expand the ever changing virtual and augment reality platforms and provide an immersive experience to the end user. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that our AR/VR sales and related revenue arrangements meet all revenue recognition criteria in addition to adhering to internal policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities will include owning the month end close accounting, and fulfillment of internal and external audit requests. The individual must be a self-starter and work with limited direction while taking full ownership of their areas of responsibility. They will be expected to problem solve, recommend solutions and exercise good business judgment while performing their functions. The candidate is expected to have a strong business acumen coupled with a technical accounting background and very strong systems and communication skills to effectively facilitate information flow between the Sales, Product, Engineering and Finance organizations. Candidate must be a driven, high energy, customer service focused individual that can work well with internal and external customers at all levels.
REVENUE MANAGER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with product and engineering teams to understand new business models, and design and implement scalable finance operational processes and systems to support the business.
Review revenue contracts to ensure compliance with GAAP (ASC 606) and internal policies.
Document technical accounting positions on significant multiple element revenue arrangements.
Own month end close procedures for the AR/VR business including preparation and review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other duties as necessary.
Streamline and improve existing finance systems and processes to enable the business and finance function to scale.
Fulfillment of internal and external audit requests.
Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to operationalize and implement various marketing initiatives.
Partner with cross-functional teams to research customer queries/issues and coordinate timely resolution.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
CPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
Proficient with ASC 606 and experience with implementing of such accounting guidance
Experience with implementing SOX 404 as well as on-going documentation
8+ years of experience in Finance/Accounting
Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Internal Controls
Project management and systems implementation experience
Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Big 4/public company experience
Experience working with Core Engineering and Payments Engineering and E-Commerce teams
Experience in the global retail and hardware industry
Experience with ASC 606 (Multiple Element Arrangement) accounting implementation
Experience with Oracle ERP

Title: Display Research and Development Engineer, AR/VR
JD:
Minimum qualifications:

Ph.D. degree in a Display related field or equivalent practical experience.
2+ years of work experience in display and R&D Environment

Preferred qualifications:

Knowledge and experience of Micro-LED architecture, epitaxy material, epitaxy growth equipment (MBE/MOCVD) and process.
Knowledge of major design, test and manufacturing challenges for micro-LED displays.
Knowledge of micro-display (LCoS, DLP, micro-OLED, micro-LED, etc) technology, familiar with display and backplane design, and fabrication process.
Knowledge of all display technologies.
Established relationships with micro-display suppliers, and equipment and material vendors.
Excellent communication and analytical skills.
About the job
Google engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. As a member of an extraordinarily creative, motivated and talented team, you develop new products that are used by millions of people. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to take on new problems as we continue to push technology forward. If you get excited about building new things and working across discipline lines, then our team might be your next career step.
Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR) are rapidly evolving as important new areas in consumer products. The Daydream team is a fast moving group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the hardware, platform, and ecosystem for ground-breaking devices, apps, and tools. In order to address complex challenges, we develop and integrate our own systems. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies to improve user productivity.

As a Display Research and Development (R&D) Engineer, you'll design and build the visual systems of the future. You will be part of a team developing high-performance and low-power displays that enable Google’s continuous innovations in AR/VR devices. Additionally, you will assess, introduce, and evaluate new and existing technologies.
The Google Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.
Responsibilities
Innovate, develop, and integrate leading edge micro-LED display technologies for VR/AR.
Demonstrate deep understanding of relationship between display technologies and its business goals.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g. Electrical, Organizational/Mechanical, Software Engineering, Display, UX) to define requirements and specifications of an advanced display to optimize the visual system.
Guide and work with display partners, and even material/component/equipment supply chain partners to solve the key challenges during display development phase.
Evaluate and test the key display image, efficiency, power, and reliability performance.

Title: Director, Product, AR/VR Growth
JD:
In the AR/VR organization, we're building the next generation of devices and experiences that let you experience anything, anywhere, with anyone. This includes Oculus and Portal products, AR and VR software and content, and research and development labs. AR/VR’s potential to connect the world is immense—and we’re just getting started. Our team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, advanced optics, eye tracking, mixed reality, and new ways to map the human body. The AR/VR Growth team is focused on connecting people to new AR/VR technologies, this includes driving new user growth and existing user retention. The Growth team is innovating and applying the best of Facebook Growth practices in a hardware product environment.


AR/VR Product Group manager will lead teams of engineers and designers to build products. We are looking for extremely entrepreneurial Product Leaders to help innovate and execute product initiatives across the company. This position is full-time and based at our Menlo Park office.
DIRECTOR, PRODUCT, AR/VR GROWTH RESPONSIBILITIES
Establish shared vision across the company by building consensus on Growth strategy and priorities leading to product execution.
Understand how to prioritize highest impact opportunities based on analysis, product strategy, and technical development.
Drive product development with a team of world-class engineers, designers, and data scientists.
Integrate design thinking, strategic metrics design, and rigour hypothesis driven experimentation to maximize impact on growth trajectories.
Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of experience in product management, product data science, or engineering for software products and technologies.
Proven track record in optimizing user acquisition channels, conversion funnels, and monetization.
Experience in user psychology, and a track-record of using these insights to create great user experiences that also accomplish business results.
Experience leading with intuition but validating through data-driven experimentation and user research.
Experience collaborating with research, design, engineering, and analytics to drive growth initiatives.

Title: Manager, Display Strategic Sourcing - AR/VR
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for spends from raw materials, to the individual components on a board, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with various suppliers and manufacturers. The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain.


Facebook is seeking a leader that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. Together with your team and numerous internal partners, you will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans the AR/VR space.
MANAGER, DISPLAY STRATEGIC SOURCING - AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Global Display module Sourcing function. Driving an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Display technology, Architecture and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Analyze, develop and implement supplier capacity and custom Display “should cost” model.
Develop deep technical and commercial relationships with executive management at suppliers.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Work in partnership with the various engineering teams to develop an approved and qualified supply base, develop strategic partnerships that address our needs and, on an ongoing basis, continuously improve supplier performance.
Partner with cross-functional teams (i.e., PM, engineering, quality, ID, PD, logistics, etc.) to continuously improve overall system-level landed cost and identify strategic trends in Facebook’s design practices that will have an impact on procurement.
Influence engineering and architecture teams for NPI development strategy and implementation, optimizing design/materials/process selection to drive lowest cost, industry leading quality, and continuity of predictable supply.
Lead Total Cost Reduction program to ensure the lowest possible total cost, including product cost, transportation cost, inventory cost, and cost of quality.
Develop commodity supplier sourcing strategy ensuring the supplier is capable of meeting Facebook’s current and future technical and business requirements.
Drive Early Supplier Involvement initiatives to ensure our suppliers are proactively providing input into new product designs and future product roadmaps.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of sourcing and procurement experience in Display and/or Electronics Commodity and technology management, including demonstrated experience managing overall supplier performance.
Engineering or Technical BS degree.
Experience working in enterprises with hardware portfolio.
Expertise in market analysis to dissect market size, players, customers, growth, technology replacements/forecasts, pricing trends, etc., to formulate sourcing strategies.
Expertise in financial statement analysis to derive should-cost models and cost competitiveness/financial strengths of suppliers, as well as gathering market intelligence.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced Engineering degree and/or MBA.
