Title: Director, Engineering, AR/VR Experiences
JD:
Facebook’s AR/VR Experiences team is exploring the potential of virtual and augmented reality to bring people together in new ways. We are designing technologies that help people to create, share meaningful moments, and build communities using the unique qualities of these immersive new mediums. We aim to develop experiences that put people first, defining a future where virtual reality enables us to connect with the people and content we care about like never before. We’re looking for a Director of Engineering to lead and grow the team developing Facebook Horizon. As a Director of Engineering, you will define the culture and operating strategy for a fast moving engineering organization aiming to empower creators to build highly engaging immersive worlds in VR and help users to enjoy connected social experiences and start meaningful friendships while exploring these worlds. You will be responsible for growing and mentoring a team of managers and tech leads that are responsible for Horizon Creator Journey, Runtime User Experience and Technology foundation including Rendering, Runtime Simulation, Social Connectivity, Backend Distributed Compute and Networking. The ideal candidate is an experienced Servant Leader with the knowledge of Performance Critical Runtime Systems and Distributed Services and experience leading highly cross-functional organizations combining contributions of multiple disciplines to ship a successful product. Desired background: games as a service at scale, asset creation tool chains, shipped AAA game titles, immersive social products in VR and on mobile.
DIRECTOR, ENGINEERING, AR/VR EXPERIENCES RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage grow and mentor a team of Managers and Tech Leads. Define organizational culture and technical strategy for Horizon Engineering team.
Establish and teach sustainable engineering practices to ensure Horizon becomes a successful Product as a Service.
Establish effective collaboration with engineering teams inside Social Experiences, AR/VR and across Facebook.
Build a culture of seamless cross-discipline collaboration between Engineering, Product, Art, Design, Data Science and User Research.
Work with Technical Program Management to develop effective Operating Model and process for the Horizon team.
Offer organizational design thinking to best structure the team and equip them for success in their goals.
Leading Software as a Service products with >1M peak concurrent users.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
12+ years of experience Developing and leading teams in the field of real time software.
10+ years of management experience with direct reports under your guidance and leadership.
5+ years of experience managing, mentoring and growing senior leaders (managers of managers).
Shipping Interactive real time experiences at scale.
Experience in platform/ecosystem products, marketplaces.
BA/BS in Computer Science or related field.

Title: AR/VR Product Design Engineer
JD:
Facebook AR/VR is building products that make it easier for you to connect with the ones you love. We are a diverse team of world-class experts developing and shipping products at the convergence of hardware, software, and social value. The team has the responsibility of taking breakthrough concepts and delivering them to the world at scale. We are seeking a Product Design Engineer who has experience in handheld and/or wearable consumer electronics. This is a full-time position based in our Menlo Park office.
AR/VR PRODUCT DESIGN ENGINEER RESPONSIBILITIES
End-to-end ownership of full product and/or module architecture from concept through launch.
Collaborate with program management, industrial design, user experience, component module, and supply chain teams.
Drive road map for next-generation materials, manufacturing processes, and/or mechanism design.
Leverage overseas teams (ODM/JDM/CM) to maximize the focus of our internal resources on adding value and differentiation to our products.
Establish and refine product design process, best practices, and/ or tools for the organization.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors or equivalent experience in Mechanical Engineering or related fields
Experience in consumer electronics or related fields
Experience in mobile and/or wearable mechanical product design, mechanical system architecture, prototype validation, and new product introduction (NPI)
Experience leading technical teams, cross-functional groups, and overseas manufacturers
Demonstrated experience in plastic and metal part design
Experience in Design for Manufacturability (DFM), Design for Assembly (DFA), statistical tolerance analysis techniques, functional dimensioning, geometric tolerancing, and 3D/2D CAD
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Masters in Mechanical Engineering or related fields
Experience with integrating component modules (AMOLED displays, batteries, camera modules, etc.), interconnect (FPC design and ACF bonding), and/or Integration of wireless antenna (GSM, GPS, Wifi, LTE) into mechanical enclosures
5+ years of experience in consumer electronics or related fields
5+ years of experience in mobile and/or wearable mechanical product design, mechanical system architecture, prototype validation, and new product introduction (NPI)
Experience in NX/Teamcenter

Title: Product Experience Quality Engineer, AR/VR Accessories
JD:
As part of our accessories team, you will help ensure high quality first party accessories for our VR, AR, and Portal core products. You will also help coordinate test plans in our engagements with partners developing second and third party accessory products. You will drive a holistic top-level plan for product quality. This includes everything from the unboxing experience and expected use, to how we support products after the sale. You will coordinate, triage and track testing performed by software/firmware, certification, reliability, and operations QA teams. You will also coordinate closely with our manufacturing partners to ensure we are producing high quality products throughout the product development process and into production. You will work on multiple accessories and leverage contract resources (both domestically and internationally) to help scale the quality process. You will play an early role in product concept reviews to provide a perspective on what features or materials should be considered for a quality experience. Your engineering and risk-management knowledge comes from prior products you’ve helped to ship along with a constant curiosity to evaluate new technologies and competitive products. Ability to travel up to 20% with some travel to China, the Asia Pacific region and within the US.
PRODUCT EXPERIENCE QUALITY ENGINEER, AR/VR ACCESSORIES RESPONSIBILITIES
Create process and procedures to consistently track project test plans, testing progress, and open issues.
Run regular bug/issue review meetings for each product in development.
Coordinate a post-sales support plan for each product.
Coordinate and contribute to engineering deliverables including specifications and test plans.
Develop processes for out-of-the-box experience testing.
Perform product/experience regression testing for new builds.
Ensure program test documents are complete, current and available for staff and leadership review.
Work cross-functionally to develop best practices and quality/test processes to support internal and external teams in developing Oculus products and Oculus certified products.
Influence product manufacturability, testability, serviceability, reliability, flexibility and cost effectiveness.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of Quality Engineering experience related to consumer electronics products.
A history of shipping reliable products that customers love.
Demonstrated technical skills and experience, including a detailed understanding of Final Assembly, Test, Pack and SMT processes.
Knowledge with program and issue tracking and version control software.
Experience leveraging third party vendors for extended test.
Experience operating in dynamic, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge for AR/VR and video conferencing technologies.
Experience with packaging.
Software testing experience (black-box user experience).
Experience with IMUs/sensor physical sensor systems with an understanding of calibration/test methods.
Experience with testing vision systems.
Experience with PC, USB, Bluetooth, or Wifi logo testing.
Experience taking products through certifications such as UL, CE, FCC, IC, or ETL.
Experience with audio performance testing.
Experience with soft goods and mechanical assemblies.
Experience with GD&T & tolerance analysis.
Experience with wearable products that require bio-compatibility testing and compliance.

Title: Manager, Channel Operations - AR/VR
JD:
The Channel Operations Manager, currently based in Menlo Park, CA (HQ), will play an exciting and important role in ensuring alignment between the strategic direction of the organization and enabling operational excellence for the function. This position will be responsible for leading, mentoring, and managing the North American Channel Operations team to support our B2B Retail and Enterprise customers and partnering closely with Sales, Fulfillment, Supply Planning, Finance, 3PL’s and other internal/external teams.

The primary functions of the role include: order management, CPFR planning and development, RMA receiving, managing the overall order to cash flow, allocation management, new partner and product on-boarding, timely and accurate inventory related reporting, primary escalation point for the team, and driving key operational initiatives as needed or required.

The manager position will report into the Head of Channel Operations within the Facebook’s AR/VR Devices organization. This position is critical to the overall success of the organization as Channel Operations ultimately ensures we have Inventory in the channel to sell. It lies at the intersection between operations, sales and our Partners and plays a critical connector role in both communication and action between these functions.
MANAGER, CHANNEL OPERATIONS - AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Build, mentor, and grow the North America channels operations team
Partnering closely with North America Sales team to support and enable market growth and customer satisfaction
Drives operational capability initiatives in support of process efficiency and adding value for Partners
Support and measure operational KPI’s and generate related reporting to improve performance
Support the allocation process and align with cross-functional partners in sales and supply planning
Continually support and improve the overall Collaborative Planning Forecasting and Replenishment processes
Ensure timely B2B RMA receiving within Partner and 3PL SLA’s and overall compliance
Align with key internal/external partners to improve the overall order to cash process
Active participation in Sales & Operations meetings and forum
Ensure internal and SOX compliance for order management processes
Back-up for Channel Operations Analysts that are traveling on leave or on PTO
Willingness and ability to travel up to 10% to domestic and international locations
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
8+ years of direct people management experience and managing the order management (order to cash) function for hardware products supporting Retail and Enterprise customers
Experience with on-boarding new partners, products, and markets
Experience managing or major contributor for CPFR processes
Proven track record of getting things done (projects, initiatives, process improvements, etc.)
Proven experience influencing all levels within the organization
Proven communication skills
Experience using Oracle, SAP, or another major ERP platform
Experience working in a fast paced, dynamic environment with changing priorities and deadlines
Bachelor’s degree

Title: Associate General Counsel, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook’s AR/VR legal group seeks an experienced, highly motivated attorney to join as Associate General Counsel to support safety, user research, integrity, and accessibility across its product lines. The AR/VR organization is building the next generation of computing devices to bring the world together and make people feel closer. This includes Oculus and Portal products, AR and VR software and hardware, and research and development labs. Success in this position will require applying a complex and evolving global legal framework to new and innovative tech products and services.


In this role, you will review products, features, and initiatives to inform on safe and accessible product design while balancing important priorities. You will help to ensure legal compliance with consumer protection laws, privacy laws and regulations, accessibility requirements and other legal requirements across multiple jurisdictions. This is a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge issues in a fast-paced start-up environment. The ideal candidate will provide front line legal support as a self-starter with strong communication, drafting, and negotiation skills working collaboratively with legal colleagues and business partners across the organization.
ASSOCIATE GENERAL COUNSEL, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze products, policies, and initiatives to develop strategy for future products and provide practical legal risk mitigation strategies across multiple jurisdictions
Provide legal support to teams developing innovative solutions to safety, integrity, and accessibility issues in new technologies and contexts
Work closely with business leads in related functions at Facebook, including UX researchers, perceptual scientists, product managers, engineers, designers, and policy teams
Provide legal advice to product, software engineering and other business teams across many subject areas, including consumer protection, privacy, integrity, and accessibility regulations
Analyze products, policies, and initiatives to develop strategy for future products and provide practical legal risk mitigation strategies across multiple jurisdictions
Build positive and influential relationships with executives, product teams, and peers across the AR/VR organization
Lead consensus building and drive coordination with other members of the legal team and teams within the business
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
J.D. degree and membership in at least one U.S. state bar
8+ years combined law firm and in-house experience, including experience working with technology companies
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience counseling clients on legal issues relating to consumer protection laws, data privacy/privacy laws, accessibility laws, and general products liability concerns
Experience working on international consumer product safety matters
Experience counseling clients on legal issues relating to cybercrimes, law enforcement requests and online safety measures

Title: Content Manager, AR/VR (Japanese Market)
JD:
Location: Menlo Park, CA
Schedule: 40 hours per week, Monday-Friday
Assignment Length: 6 month contract
Job Description

HireArt is helping our client hire a Content Manager, AR/VR for Japanese-speaking audiences. Candidates must have bilingual fluency in Japanese and English.
As a Content Manager, you’ll set up editorial calendars, campaigns, and the taxonomy for Apps and Games relevant to Japan. This role will also manage a CMS content for the company’s e-commerce site that brings innovative and cutting edge AR/VR products to Japanese markets across the globe.

This is a highly cross-functional role collaborating with teams including content discovery, marketing, engineering, and product teams to launch content within the company’s CMS.
The ideal candidate for this role has a strong knowledge of the games industry in Japan, cultural moments, and an expert on tailoring content for Japanese users. A strong technical background and exceptional writing and communication skills in both Japanese and English, with extensive knowledge of operational roles, creative editorial work, and developer relations.
As Content Manager, AR/VR, you will:
Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.
Assign, edit, and write content for the App Store, including short-form write-ups, deep dives, developer interviews and translate long-format articles from cross-functional teams.
Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.
Requirements
3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position (with potential for extension) through HireArt and based in Menlo Park, CA. Open to candidates willing to relocate at their own expense.

Title: Revenue Manager, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook is seeking to fill the role of Revenue Manager supporting the virtual reality (AR/VR) business. Our AR/VR business includes hardware (Oculus and Portal products) and software products. The team’s focus is connecting people through the Portal products and expand the ever changing virtual and augment reality platforms and provide an immersive experience to the end user. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that our AR/VR sales and related revenue arrangements meet all revenue recognition criteria in addition to adhering to internal policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities will include owning the month end close accounting, and fulfillment of internal and external audit requests. The individual must be a self-starter and work with limited direction while taking full ownership of their areas of responsibility. They will be expected to problem solve, recommend solutions and exercise good business judgment while performing their functions. The candidate is expected to have a strong business acumen coupled with a technical accounting background and very strong systems and communication skills to effectively facilitate information flow between the Sales, Product, Engineering and Finance organizations. Candidate must be a driven, high energy, customer service focused individual that can work well with internal and external customers at all levels.
REVENUE MANAGER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with product and engineering teams to understand new business models, and design and implement scalable finance operational processes and systems to support the business.
Review revenue contracts to ensure compliance with GAAP (ASC 606) and internal policies.
Document technical accounting positions on significant multiple element revenue arrangements.
Own month end close procedures for the AR/VR business including preparation and review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other duties as necessary.
Streamline and improve existing finance systems and processes to enable the business and finance function to scale.
Fulfillment of internal and external audit requests.
Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to operationalize and implement various marketing initiatives.
Partner with cross-functional teams to research customer queries/issues and coordinate timely resolution.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
CPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
Proficient with ASC 606 and experience with implementing of such accounting guidance
Experience with implementing SOX 404 as well as on-going documentation
8+ years of experience in Finance/Accounting
Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Internal Controls
Project management and systems implementation experience
Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Big 4/public company experience
Experience working with Core Engineering and Payments Engineering and E-Commerce teams
Experience in the global retail and hardware industry
Experience with ASC 606 (Multiple Element Arrangement) accounting implementation
Experience with Oracle ERP

Title: Mechanical Engineer - AR/VR Accessories
JD:
As a Mechanical Engineer on the Facebook AR/VR accessories team, you will help bring products to market that enable our core products to reach additional customer needs, make it easier to use our products longer, and enhance the core product experiences. You’ll be part of a product group that is focused on rapid development and execution of accessory products through a combination of in-house teams and overseeing external partners (both CM and ODM development models). You will work on cutting edge technologies with a diverse cross-functional team of engineers and scientists that pioneer mechanical, electrical, materials, firmware, software and computer vision solutions. We value people who work well in teams, can take project ownership at a systems level, and are able to drive a concept from a high fidelity prototype to a high-volume consumer product.
MECHANICAL ENGINEER - AR/VR ACCESSORIES RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Industrial Design, Hardware Engineering and Product teams to create functional prototypes based on concepts in the accessories roadmap and deliver final products to mass production.
Identify components, materials, and manufacturing process that achieve a high quality product within cost targets at high volume.
Create mechanical architecture and detailed 3D models according to established specifications.
Leverage internal resources and drive overseas partners (ODM/JDM/CM) to expand the capabilities of our team and deliver on projects.
Apply engineering and tolerance techniques to high precision design requirements in the areas such as optics, electro-mechanicals, and battery/power systems.
Establish and refine product design process, best practices, and/or tools for the organization.
Lead cross-functional design reviews and engineering discussions.

Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience.
7+ years of experience in a hands-on Engineering/Design role with experience in high volume consumer electronics and product development.

Experience working with China-based vendors remotely and in-person, including a variety of engineering engagement models (CM, JDM and ODM).
Problem solving skills and experience working independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Manufacturing knowledge and experience (Design for assembly, DFM with injection molding, die-cast, machining, sheet metals, die-cuts etc.).
Knowledge of designing electrical sub-systems (PCBs, FPCs, interconnects, batteries, etc.).
Experience with system level design and working with cross-functional teams including Engineering, Product Design, Research, etc.
3D CAD design experience and working with complex ID surfaces.
Understanding of GD&T and tolerance analysis methods.
Experience of building part and assembly prototypes in a prototype shop environment.

10+ years of product design/prototyping and R&D experience, including full systems ownership.
Mandarin language skills.
NX/Teamcenter CAD system knowledge.
Knowledge of statistical problem solving approach.
Design Analysis experience (FEA Structural Simulations).
Experience with wearables and soft-goods design.

Knowledge for AR/VR and video conferencing technologies.

Title: AR/VR Test Development Engineer
JD:
The AR/VR Test Development Engineer - Tracking System Calibration applies the highest level of skill and knowledge of Computer Vision domains in designing architecture and developing algorithms for calibration. You will drive conceptual calibration system hardware design with technology groups in early product exploration stage, validate first article design in the lab and deploy in factories. You will lead the end-to-end development of software and hardware integration, includes calibration flow, robotics-motion control, data capture and process, and integration of advance algorithms with third-party partners. You will be leading in documenting and troubleshooting station hardware/software issues on test equipment and systems and bridge to production. The ideal candidate is a self-driven individual working in a cross-functional team environment and will be responsible for planning the design, development, and implementation of factory test/calibration systems which include equipment, fixtures and software. You will enforce manufacturability, testability and ensure cost-effective designs are implemented for testing and automation systems, software, and equipment. This position will have responsibilities for NTI and NPI test development and bridge to sustaining support of production. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. We are looking for someone with a productive mindset who can apply their expertise to solve problems in creative, insightful ways.
AR/VR TEST DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and deploy advanced manufacturing-ready test stations and accompanying software infrastructure for AR/VR products.
Analyze, evaluate, design, integrate and test first article fixture to meet specification and proof of concept.
Develops camera intrinsic and extrinsic calibration specifications, procedures, and debug guides for test solutions.
Lead functional technology groups and drive cross-functional decisions on test development and architecture.
Validation of test SW releases, including repeatability and negative testing, and coordinate SW upgrades with fixture integrator and CM/JDM partners.
Troubleshoot and debug test systems and automation solutions from a software and hardware perspective in full autonomy.
Oversee rollout and validation of SW/FW releases at manufacturing partner.
Coordinates third-party vendors in designing, fabricating and developing test systems.
Support failure analysis on systems returned from the field and use data to improve test strategies and processes.
Travel up to ~30%, includes domestic and International travels for collaboration with research teams and factory builds support.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics or equivalent with 1+ year of experience in developing test solution in a consumer electronics or related field.
Experience developing hardware test solutions utilizing robotics/precision motion system design.
Experience with multiple sensor system calibration.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master/Ph.D. in relevant degree with backgrounds in computer vision, robotics, SLAM, and/or mechatronics.
Experience in Python, C/C++ or other programming language in robust fault-tolerant instrumentation/control applications.
Experience developing calibration stations for multi camera systems and/or IMU sensors.
Experience developing hardware test solutions internally and with third-party.
Knowledge of camera calibration concepts such as optical distortion calibration, SLAM, and 3D reconstruction.
Experience in mathematics such as multi-dimensional transformations, pinhole camera model, stereo vision model.
Knowledge in statistical methods (6s, SPC, Cpk) for data analytics.
Experience designing and executing development projects with a design of experiment approach (DOE) to service, troubleshoot, and solve engineering problems.
Experience in factory test for consumer electronics products.

Title: Manager, Audio Strategic Sourcing - AR/VR
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for spends from raw materials, to the individual components on a board, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with various suppliers and manufacturers.

The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain. Facebook is seeking a leader that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware.

In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. Together with your team and numerous internal partners, you will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans the AR/VR space.
MANAGER, AUDIO STRATEGIC SOURCING - AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Audio or Acoustics Sourcing function. Drive an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Work in partnership with the various engineering teams to develop an approved and qualified supply base, develop strategic partnerships that address our needs and, on an ongoing basis, continuously improve supplier performance.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Audio or Acoustics technology, architecture, and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Analyze, develop and implement supplier capacity and Audio or Acoustics “should cost” models.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Partner with cross-functional teams (i.e., PM, engineering, quality, ID, PD, logistics, etc.) to continuously improve overall system-level landed cost and identify strategic trends in Facebook’s design practices that will have an impact on procurement.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of sourcing and procurement experience in Audio/Acoustics Commodity and technology management, including demonstrated experience managing overall supplier performance.
Engineering or technical BS degree.
Experience working in enterprises with hardware portfolio.
Experience in setting up, running, and optimizing a global, outsourced manufacturing supply chain.
Demonstrated experience in hiring, training and developing sourcing teams.
Fundamental knowledge of Acoustic transducer (speaker and microphone) in the context of acoustic system design.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced engineering degree and/or MBA.
Experience moving seamlessly from strategy to execution and deliver tangible results.
Experience with overall audio system design, (i.e., acoustic system integration, audio transducer design, sound quality evaluation, audio analyzers, DSP, MEMS development, etc.).

Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.

Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.

3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Fundamental knowledge of software engineering technologies, methodologies, and practices
Familiarity with 3D math, linear algebra, 3D geometry, graphics, and rendering
Description
The ideal engineer for this role is comfortable working in a dynamic and creative team charged with exploring an uncharted and rapidly evolving domain. You will be researching and developing an entirely new application paradigm - a challenge that will demand rapid experimentation and prototyping without sacrificing code quality or attention to detail. You'll need a keen understanding of the state of the art in interactive 3D applications and an ambition to discover what the future holds in this space. We are building a passionate and diverse team that will span a broad range of application categories including productivity, communication, and entertainment.
Education & Experience
BS / MS / PhD in Computer Science OR equivalent degree OR equivalent experience
Additional Requirements
Interest or proficiency in UI/UX design
Proficiency in macOS, iOS, tvOS or watchOS development Experience with low-level graphics APIs (Metal, OpenGL, DirectX)
Experience developing AR/VR applications
Familiarity with ARKit
Experience using iOS frameworks like UIKit, AVFoundation, Core Motion, Core ML, CloudKit, SiriKit, StoreKit, etc.
Experience with Unix development, daemons, cross-process communication, etc

Title: AR/VR Category Business Manager
JD:
The AR/VR Category Business Manager is responsible for all business related activities within the assigned product category. They will craft category business plans, go-to-market strategies, positioning, and channel activation plans for specific category business units of Facebook's AR/VR division. For products that are in-market the Category Business Managers will establish and run a rhythm of business with cross-functional stakeholders and align cross-functional Key Objectives and Results.
AR/VR CATEGORY BUSINESS MANAGER RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and partner with Product Management and Product Marketing stakeholders on the strategy for launching and sustaining AR/VR products and services across channels (retail, first party webstore and enterprise) by being the partner through the product development process
Drive and deliver go-to-market timelines and sales org deliverables as part of the product development process for assigned categories
Partner with sales and demand planners to provide early estimate forecasting and revenue for the category business and category product lines
Drive agreement on key channel objectives and strategies for the category and products with Product Marketing Management and Channel Account teams, globally
Communicate key issues and opportunities to cross-functional core product groups to influence overall platform strategy, pricing, packaging and product decisions in the category
Maintain a strong knowledge and awareness of the category industry and competitive trends
Establish category goals for the half and socialize those goals cross functionally for organizational buy in toward achievement
Work with Launch Management to programatize and ramp GTM for new inbound product launches. Connecting and coordinating launches across key channels and markets
Be the distribution expert for key initiatives and respective products in the channel and evangelize key takeaways with the product groups and cross-functional teams
Provides strategic category & marketing plans and deliver integrated sales pitch decks and new item launch materials for use by the key account managers and Category Performance Managers
Deliver monthly Category updates to the core sales team inclusive of NPI status, category insights and cross-functional alignments
Compiles and delivers feedback to marketing and product management
Manages YOY growth and market share metrics
Travel requirements: 30%

Bachelor’s degree
7+ years of experience in Category Management, Product Management, Product Marketing, Finance and Analytics or some relevant combination
Demonstrated understanding of channel environment, consumer, and overall marketplace dynamics impacting the AR/VR/Smart screen categories
Knowledge in online motions and consumer purchase habits by account and product
Communicator, with presentation skills and experience presenting to leadership from internal and external organizations
Advanced skill with either Google Sheets and Slides or Excel and PowerPoint

Master’s degree/MBA
Experience with P&L management of $200 million and annual business(es), with at least 3 years of direct P&L accountability/management experience
Experience adapting and supporting the organization through times of change
An entrepreneurial mindset
Experience influencing without authority
Experience precisely and proficiently conducting business and data analyses with data driven recommendations for improvements and advancements
Experience building various levels of strong ongoing customer and organizational relationships
Experience understanding, translating and mapping strategic business and competitive priorities into analysis and deliver insights
Exceptional problem solving, project and program management skills

Title: Manager, Software Engineering, AR/VR - Audio Algorithms
JD:
The AR/VR organization's mission is to give people the tools to feel connected anytime, anywhere. We create new, category-defining consumer hardware and software that are immersive, social, and increase the depth of people's connections. The team is a diverse group of problem solvers, inventors, and proven visionaries who are relentless about transforming everyday occurrences into rich experiences that have the potential to improve the way billions of people live.


The Portal team brings together world-class experts to develop and ship groundbreaking products at the intersection of hardware, software, and content. We have a clear mandate to ship products at scale. In particular, seemingly impossible products that define new categories and that advance Facebook's mission of connecting the world. Facebook Portal team is looking for an Engineering Manager with strong technical expertise in the audio algorithm space. You will be responsible for leading software engineers building the audio stack that powers Portal. The ideal candidate will have a good understanding of algorithm development or system engineering catering to embedded/mobile platforms. You will bring strong people management skill in combination with deep technical knowledge to enable the launch of best in class consumer electronic products from Facebook.
MANAGER, SOFTWARE ENGINEERING, AR/VR - AUDIO ALGORITHMS RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage a team of algorithm and software engineers that builds the audio stack for consumer electronics products from Facebook Portal.
Be both a technical leader in the audio domain and a people manager.
Manage engineers and help them develop their careers, assigning them to projects tailored to their skill levels, long-term skill development, personalities, and work styles.
Communicate and collaborate effectively with cross-functional hardware and software engineering teams.
Champion engineering and operational excellence, establishing metrics and process for regular assessment and improvement.
Set clear expectations and create a positive work environment based on accountability, in collaboration with the engineering and management teams.
Work closely with dedicated recruiting staff to expand the team, including sourcing candidates, interviewing candidates, participating in conferences/events, and on-boarding new employees.
Define, build new algorithms and add enhancements to existing algorithms to support human listening, machine listening and other new experiences on portal family devices.
Define the subjective and objective performance metrics for various core audio algorithm components that ultimately roll into program level KPIs.
Tune algorithms that are built in-house and by external partners to provide high fidelity audio performance with negligible audio artifacts and to pass performance goals.
Port and Optimize the algorithms to fit on limited CPU and Memory on DSP and SoC sub systems.
Dive deep and troubleshoot audio functional performance issues and work with audio QA and triage teams to reproduce, fix and validate the solution.
Work with cross-functional partners to create new algorithm features on the roadmap and deliver committed features.
Keep abreast with latest technological advancements in academia and in industry and bring new innovation and value to Portal customers.
Provide subject matter expertise in assessing third party solutions for technical readiness and critically reviewing the performance of solutions showcased.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of experience managing engineering teams.
5+ years of experience in algorithm developer, or system engineer roles catering to embedded/mobile platforms.
Proven track record of building and supporting cross-functional teams.
Experience supporting, coaching, mentoring, and developing engineers.
Knowledge in Audio capture or render algorithms for consumer devices.
Experience in designing and building echo cancellation, noise suppression, wake word, or spatial audio compression algorithms in real world products.

HireArt is helping our client hire a Content Manager, AR/VR for Japanese-speaking audiences. Candidates must have bilingual fluency in Japanese and English.
As a Content Manager, you’ll set up editorial calendars, campaigns, and the taxonomy for Apps and Games relevant to Japan. This role will also manage a CMS content for the company’s e-commerce site that brings innovative and cutting edge AR/VR products to Japanese markets across the globe.

This is a highly cross-functional role collaborating with teams including content discovery, marketing, engineering, and product teams to launch content within the company’s CMS.
The ideal candidate for this role has a strong knowledge of the games industry in Japan, cultural moments, and an expert on tailoring content for Japanese users. A strong technical background and exceptional writing and communication skills in both Japanese and English, with extensive knowledge of operational roles, creative editorial work, and developer relations.
As Content Manager, AR/VR, you will:
Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.
Assign, edit, and write content for the App Store, including short-form write-ups, deep dives, developer interviews and translate long-format articles from cross-functional teams.
Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.
Requirements
3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Title: Revenue Manager, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook is seeking to fill the role of Revenue Manager supporting the virtual reality (AR/VR) business. Our AR/VR business includes hardware (Oculus and Portal products) and software products. The team’s focus is connecting people through the Portal products and expand the ever changing virtual and augment reality platforms and provide an immersive experience to the end user. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring that our AR/VR sales and related revenue arrangements meet all revenue recognition criteria in addition to adhering to internal policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities will include owning the month end close accounting, and fulfillment of internal and external audit requests. The individual must be a self-starter and work with limited direction while taking full ownership of their areas of responsibility. They will be expected to problem solve, recommend solutions and exercise good business judgment while performing their functions. The candidate is expected to have a strong business acumen coupled with a technical accounting background and very strong systems and communication skills to effectively facilitate information flow between the Sales, Product, Engineering and Finance organizations. Candidate must be a driven, high energy, customer service focused individual that can work well with internal and external customers at all levels.
REVENUE MANAGER, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with product and engineering teams to understand new business models, and design and implement scalable finance operational processes and systems to support the business.
Review revenue contracts to ensure compliance with GAAP (ASC 606) and internal policies.
Document technical accounting positions on significant multiple element revenue arrangements.
Own month end close procedures for the AR/VR business including preparation and review of journal entries, reconciliations, and other duties as necessary.
Streamline and improve existing finance systems and processes to enable the business and finance function to scale.
Fulfillment of internal and external audit requests.
Partner with Sales and Marketing teams to operationalize and implement various marketing initiatives.
Partner with cross-functional teams to research customer queries/issues and coordinate timely resolution.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
CPA
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related field
Proficient with ASC 606 and experience with implementing of such accounting guidance
Experience with implementing SOX 404 as well as on-going documentation
8+ years of experience in Finance/Accounting
Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and Internal Controls
Project management and systems implementation experience
Experience with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Big 4/public company experience
Experience working with Core Engineering and Payments Engineering and E-Commerce teams
Experience in the global retail and hardware industry
Experience with ASC 606 (Multiple Element Arrangement) accounting implementation
Experience with Oracle ERP

Title: Mechanical Engineer - AR/VR Accessories
JD:
As a Mechanical Engineer on the Facebook AR/VR accessories team, you will help bring products to market that enable our core products to reach additional customer needs, make it easier to use our products longer, and enhance the core product experiences. You’ll be part of a product group that is focused on rapid development and execution of accessory products through a combination of in-house teams and overseeing external partners (both CM and ODM development models). You will work on cutting edge technologies with a diverse cross-functional team of engineers and scientists that pioneer mechanical, electrical, materials, firmware, software and computer vision solutions. We value people who work well in teams, can take project ownership at a systems level, and are able to drive a concept from a high fidelity prototype to a high-volume consumer product.
MECHANICAL ENGINEER - AR/VR ACCESSORIES RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Industrial Design, Hardware Engineering and Product teams to create functional prototypes based on concepts in the accessories roadmap and deliver final products to mass production.
Identify components, materials, and manufacturing process that achieve a high quality product within cost targets at high volume.
Create mechanical architecture and detailed 3D models according to established specifications.
Leverage internal resources and drive overseas partners (ODM/JDM/CM) to expand the capabilities of our team and deliver on projects.
Apply engineering and tolerance techniques to high precision design requirements in the areas such as optics, electro-mechanicals, and battery/power systems.
Establish and refine product design process, best practices, and/or tools for the organization.
Lead cross-functional design reviews and engineering discussions.

Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience.
7+ years of experience in a hands-on Engineering/Design role with experience in high volume consumer electronics and product development.
A history of full mechanical system ownership in at least two shipping products.
Experience working with China-based vendors remotely and in-person, including a variety of engineering engagement models (CM, JDM and ODM).
Problem solving skills and experience working independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Manufacturing knowledge and experience (Design for assembly, DFM with injection molding, die-cast, machining, sheet metals, die-cuts etc.).
Knowledge of designing electrical sub-systems (PCBs, FPCs, interconnects, batteries, etc.).
Experience with system level design and working with cross-functional teams including Engineering, Product Design, Research, etc.
3D CAD design experience and working with complex ID surfaces.
Understanding of GD&T and tolerance analysis methods.
Experience of building part and assembly prototypes in a prototype shop environment.

10+ years of product design/prototyping and R&D experience, including full systems ownership.
Mandarin language skills.
NX/Teamcenter CAD system knowledge.
Knowledge of statistical problem solving approach.
Design Analysis experience (FEA Structural Simulations).
Experience with wearables and soft-goods design.

Title: Associate General Counsel, AR/VR
JD:
Facebook’s AR/VR legal group seeks an experienced, highly motivated attorney to join as Associate General Counsel to support safety, user research, integrity, and accessibility across its product lines. The AR/VR organization is building the next generation of computing devices to bring the world together and make people feel closer. This includes Oculus and Portal products, AR and VR software and hardware, and research and development labs. Success in this position will require applying a complex and evolving global legal framework to new and innovative tech products and services.


In this role, you will review products, features, and initiatives to inform on safe and accessible product design while balancing important priorities. You will help to ensure legal compliance with consumer protection laws, privacy laws and regulations, accessibility requirements and other legal requirements across multiple jurisdictions. ASSOCIATE GENERAL COUNSEL, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze products, policies, and initiatives to develop strategy for future products and provide practical legal risk mitigation strategies across multiple jurisdictions
Provide legal support to teams developing innovative solutions to safety, integrity, and accessibility issues in new technologies and contexts
Work closely with business leads in related functions at Facebook, including UX researchers, perceptual scientists, product managers, engineers, designers, and policy teams
Provide legal advice to product, software engineering and other business teams across many subject areas, including consumer protection, privacy, integrity, and accessibility regulations
Analyze products, policies, and initiatives to develop strategy for future products and provide practical legal risk mitigation strategies across multiple jurisdictions
Build positive and influential relationships with executives, product teams, and peers across the AR/VR organization
Lead consensus building and drive coordination with other members of the legal team and teams within the business

J.D. degree and membership in at least one U.S. state bar
8+ years combined law firm and in-house experience, including experience working with technology companies

Experience counseling clients on legal issues relating to cybercrimes, law enforcement requests and online safety measures

Title: AR/VR Test Development Engineer
JD:
The AR/VR Test Development Engineer - Tracking System Calibration applies the highest level of skill and knowledge of Computer Vision domains in designing architecture and developing algorithms for calibration. You will drive conceptual calibration system hardware design with technology groups in early product exploration stage, validate first article design in the lab and deploy in factories. You will lead the end-to-end development of software and hardware integration, includes calibration flow, robotics-motion control, data capture and process, and integration of advance algorithms with third-party partners. You will be leading in documenting and troubleshooting station hardware/software issues on test equipment and systems and bridge to production. The ideal candidate is a self-driven individual working in a cross-functional team environment and will be responsible for planning the design, development, and implementation of factory test/calibration systems which include equipment, fixtures and software. You will enforce manufacturability, testability and ensure cost-effective designs are implemented for testing and automation systems, software, and equipment. This position will have responsibilities for NTI and NPI test development and bridge to sustaining support of production. You must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. We are looking for someone with a productive mindset who can apply their expertise to solve problems in creative, insightful ways.
AR/VR TEST DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and deploy advanced manufacturing-ready test stations and accompanying software infrastructure for AR/VR products.
Analyze, evaluate, design, integrate and test first article fixture to meet specification and proof of concept.
Develops camera intrinsic and extrinsic calibration specifications, procedures, and debug guides for test solutions.
Lead functional technology groups and drive cross-functional decisions on test development and architecture.
Validation of test SW releases, including repeatability and negative testing, and coordinate SW upgrades with fixture integrator and CM/JDM partners.
Troubleshoot and debug test systems and automation solutions from a software and hardware perspective in full autonomy.
Oversee rollout and validation of SW/FW releases at manufacturing partner.
Coordinates third-party vendors in designing, fabricating and developing test systems.
Support failure analysis on systems returned from the field and use data to improve test strategies and processes.
Travel up to ~30%, includes domestic and International travels for collaboration with research teams and factory builds support.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics or equivalent with 1+ year of experience in developing test solution in a consumer electronics or related field.
Experience developing hardware test solutions utilizing robotics/precision motion system design.
Experience with multiple sensor system calibration.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master/Ph.D. in relevant degree with backgrounds in computer vision, robotics, SLAM, and/or mechatronics.
Experience in Python, C/C++ or other programming language in robust fault-tolerant instrumentation/control applications.
Experience developing calibration stations for multi camera systems and/or IMU sensors.
Experience developing hardware test solutions internally and with third-party.
Knowledge of camera calibration concepts such as optical distortion calibration, SLAM, and 3D reconstruction.

Title: Manager, Audio Strategic Sourcing - AR/VR
JD:
Facebook designs, develops, and builds all its own AR/VR and Portal HW products. The Strategic Sourcing team is responsible for spends from raw materials, to the individual components on a board, to the final consumer end product. The team owns the commercial growth strategy and business relationships with various suppliers and manufacturers.

The sourcing team moves fast and leverages key partnerships to drive technical innovation, high quality standards and cost-savings via a customized supply chain. Facebook is seeking a leader that creates disruptive value by influencing the product definitions, designs, and specifications for our organization, and manufacturing of our AR/VR and Portal hardware.

In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing across our ecosystem, including the commercial, operational and technical performance of our technology and supplier base. Together with your team and numerous internal partners, you will be responsible for quality, product and material availability, and cost that spans the AR/VR space.
MANAGER, AUDIO STRATEGIC SOURCING - AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall vision, strategy and execution plan for the Audio or Acoustics Sourcing function. Drive an integrated long-term supplier development approach focused on delivering world class quality, delivery and cost.
Work in partnership with the various engineering teams to develop an approved and qualified supply base, develop strategic partnerships that address our needs and, on an ongoing basis, continuously improve supplier performance.
Negotiate and execute master supply contracts and other critical agreements including but not limited to licensing agreements, SOWs, etc.
Establish, manage and own strategic supplier relationships at the supplier executive level.
Develop, manage and refresh individual and customized Audio or Acoustics technology, architecture, and commodity sourcing strategies for each actively managed technology.
Lead Supplier QBR process focused on exceeding Facebook KPI’s and continuous performance improvement.
Analyze, develop and implement supplier capacity and Audio or Acoustics “should cost” models.
Influence supplier technology roadmaps and create internal disruptive value-add to ensure Facebook’s system architecture and commercial requirements are met.
Partner with cross-functional teams (i.e., PM, engineering, quality, ID, PD, logistics, etc.) to continuously improve overall system-level landed cost and identify strategic trends in Facebook’s design practices that will have an impact on procurement.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of sourcing and procurement experience in Audio/Acoustics Commodity and technology management, including demonstrated experience managing overall supplier performance.
Engineering or technical BS degree.
Experience working in enterprises with hardware portfolio.
Experience in setting up, running, and optimizing a global, outsourced manufacturing supply chain.
Demonstrated experience in hiring, training and developing sourcing teams.
Fundamental knowledge of Acoustic transducer (speaker and microphone) in the context of acoustic system design.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced engineering degree and/or MBA.
Experience moving seamlessly from strategy to execution and deliver tangible results.
Experience with overall audio system design, (i.e., acoustic system integration, audio transducer design, sound quality evaluation, audio analyzers, DSP, MEMS development, etc.).

Title: AR/VR Category Business Manager
JD:
The AR/VR Category Business Manager is responsible for all business related activities within the assigned product category. They will craft category business plans, go-to-market strategies, positioning, and channel activation plans for specific category business units of Facebook's AR/VR division. For products that are in-market the Category Business Managers will establish and run a rhythm of business with cross-functional stakeholders and align cross-functional Key Objectives and Results.
AR/VR CATEGORY BUSINESS MANAGER RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop and partner with Product Management and Product Marketing stakeholders on the strategy for launching and sustaining AR/VR products and services across channels (retail, first party webstore and enterprise) by being the partner through the product development process
Drive and deliver go-to-market timelines and sales org deliverables as part of the product development process for assigned categories
Partner with sales and demand planners to provide early estimate forecasting and revenue for the category business and category product lines
Drive agreement on key channel objectives and strategies for the category and products with Product Marketing Management and Channel Account teams, globally
Communicate key issues and opportunities to cross-functional core product groups to influence overall platform strategy, pricing, packaging and product decisions in the category
Maintain a strong knowledge and awareness of the category industry and competitive trends
Establish category goals for the half and socialize those goals cross functionally for organizational buy in toward achievement
Work with Launch Management to programatize and ramp GTM for new inbound product launches. Connecting and coordinating launches across key channels and markets

Title: Software Engineer - Android, AR/VR
JD:
AR/VR’s mission is “to give people the tools to feel connected anytime, anywhere.” The teams working on augmented and virtual reality technologies at Facebook are on a mission to build the next computing platform centered around people. We continue to push the state-of-the-art with groundbreaking research into emerging technologies and hardware that will help bring this vision to life. We are building a team focused on building new products that support this mission. The team will be building communication experiences for new hardware devices, examples including messaging, real-time communication and fitness experiences. The team is seeking for experienced Software Engineers with expertise in developing Android applications and frameworks, specifically in embedded environments. A successful candidate will have deep understanding of Android app development and ideally have experience with messaging, RTC, or fitness. This person is self-driven, passionate, and able to work across the application stack. They will take initiative and should be willing to execute consistently in a fast-paced environment.
SOFTWARE ENGINEER - ANDROID, AR/VR RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with product management, design and partners to understand and define requirements
Design, develop, and test Android-based applications runs on consumer electronics product around messaging, real-time communication, self-care and fitness
Collaborate in a team environment across multiple scientific and engineering disciplines, making the architectural tradeoffs required to rapidly deliver software solutions
Work with the platform and application teams to debug functional, performance and stability issues
Participate in design reviews and code reviews for various new applications, in both front-end and back-end
Write clean readable code, debug complex problems, prioritize ruthlessly and get things done with a high level of efficiency
Learn constantly, dive into new areas with unfamiliar technologies, and embrace the ambiguity of problem solving
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
5+ years of experience with Android app development and Android SDK
5+ years of experience in coding in Java or Kotlin
Experience with shipping high-quality consumer products
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience with full-stack application development

Title: Manager, Software Engineering, AR/VR - Audio Algorithms
JD:
The AR/VR organization's mission is to give people the tools to feel connected anytime, anywhere. We create new, category-defining consumer hardware and software that are immersive, social, and increase the depth of people's connections. The team is a diverse group of problem solvers, inventors, and proven visionaries who are relentless about transforming everyday occurrences into rich experiences that have the potential to improve the way billions of people live.


The Portal team brings together world-class experts to develop and ship groundbreaking products at the intersection of hardware, software, and content. We have a clear mandate to ship products at scale. In particular, seemingly impossible products that define new categories and that advance Facebook's mission of connecting the world. Facebook Portal team is looking for an Engineering Manager with strong technical expertise in the audio algorithm space. You will be responsible for leading software engineers building the audio stack that powers Portal. The ideal candidate will have a good understanding of algorithm development or system engineering catering to embedded/mobile platforms. You will bring strong people management skill in combination with deep technical knowledge to enable the launch of best in class consumer electronic products from Facebook.
MANAGER, SOFTWARE ENGINEERING, AR/VR - AUDIO ALGORITHMS RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage a team of algorithm and software engineers that builds the audio stack for consumer electronics products from Facebook Portal.
Be both a technical leader in the audio domain and a people manager.
Manage engineers and help them develop their careers, assigning them to projects tailored to their skill levels, long-term skill development, personalities, and work styles.
Communicate and collaborate effectively with cross-functional hardware and software engineering teams.
Champion engineering and operational excellence, establishing metrics and process for regular assessment and improvement.
Set clear expectations and create a positive work environment based on accountability, in collaboration with the engineering and management teams.
Work closely with dedicated recruiting staff to expand the team, including sourcing candidates, interviewing candidates, participating in conferences/events, and on-boarding new employees.
Define, build new algorithms and add enhancements to existing algorithms to support human listening, machine listening and other new experiences on portal family devices.
Define the subjective and objective performance metrics for various core audio algorithm components that ultimately roll into program level KPIs.
Tune algorithms that are built in-house and by external partners to provide high fidelity audio performance with negligible audio artifacts and to pass performance goals.
Port and Optimize the algorithms to fit on limited CPU and Memory on DSP and SoC sub systems.
Dive deep and troubleshoot audio functional performance issues and work with audio QA and triage teams to reproduce, fix and validate the solution.
Work with cross-functional partners to create new algorithm features on the roadmap and deliver committed features.
Keep abreast with latest technological advancements in academia and in industry and bring new innovation and value to Portal customers.
Provide subject matter expertise in assessing third party solutions for technical readiness and critically reviewing the performance of solutions showcased.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of experience managing engineering teams.
5+ years of experience in algorithm developer, or system engineer roles catering to embedded/mobile platforms.
Proven track record of building and supporting cross-functional teams.
Experience supporting, coaching, mentoring, and developing engineers.
Knowledge in Audio capture or render algorithms for consumer devices.
Experience in designing and building echo cancellation, noise suppression, wake word, or spatial audio compression algorithms in real world products.

Title: Content Manager, AR/VR (Japanese Market)
JD:
Location: Menlo Park, CA
Schedule: 40 hours per week, Monday-Friday
Assignment Length: 6 month contract
Job Description

HireArt is helping our client hire a Content Manager, AR/VR for Japanese-speaking audiences. Candidates must have bilingual fluency in Japanese and English.
As a Content Manager, you’ll set up editorial calendars, campaigns, and the taxonomy for Apps and Games relevant to Japan. This role will also manage a CMS content for the company’s e-commerce site that brings innovative and cutting edge AR/VR products to Japanese markets across the globe.

This is a highly cross-functional role collaborating with teams including content discovery, marketing, engineering, and product teams to launch content within the company’s CMS.
The ideal candidate for this role has a strong knowledge of the games industry in Japan, cultural moments, and an expert on tailoring content for Japanese users. A strong technical background and exceptional writing and communication skills in both Japanese and English, with extensive knowledge of operational roles, creative editorial work, and developer relations.
As Content Manager, AR/VR, you will:
Curate and manage the App Store and an extensive editorial calendar for Japan.
Assign, edit, and write content for the App Store, including short-form write-ups, deep dives, developer interviews and translate long-format articles from cross-functional teams.
Strategize content release dates and key programming moments for the region.
Create, manage, and publish content across CMS platforms.
Manage CMS pipeline from ingestion to reporting.
Understand best practices across pricing strategies and sales.
Adhere to brand and content standards and guidelines.
Create internal development documentation and best-practices.
Work cross-functionally with marketing, creative, and technical teams.
Requirements
3+ years editing creative editorial for traditional and/or online publications
Experience leading designers and coming up with creative design ideas
Best practices for editorial engagement and written style guides
Excellent organizational skills plus the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously under strict deadlines
Fluent (speaking, reading, writing) in Japanese and English
Experience working with Content Management Systems
Track record of copywriting and merchandizing for a Japanese market
Passion for emerging technology and the AR/VR industry

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position (with potential for extension) through HireArt and based in Menlo Park, CA. Open to candidates willing to relocate at their own expense.
